lorebooks.name: Grey Blades
lorebooks.website_description: N/A
lorebooks.description: Grey Blades Info
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The Lelison Empire and the Grey Blades
Overview
The Lelison refers both to the Empire and the continent it dominates, under the absolute rule of Garson "Eternal" Eucartos. Once a fractured land of multiple independent kingdoms, the continent was subjugated and unified by Garson through relentless conquest, political cunning, and the overwhelming might of his elite military ‚Äî the Grey Blades.

Garson "Eternal" Eucartos
Garson Eucartos, known as the "Eternal," is the sovereign emperor of Lelison. Through a campaign of both brutal warfare and calculated diplomacy, Garson systematically dismantled the old order of kings and lords, forging a singular, absolute rule under his Imperial banner. His reign is characterized by both fear and reverence, his name synonymous with authority across the continent.

The Grey Blades
The Grey Blades serve as the primary military force of the Lelison Empire. They are a symbol of Garson‚Äôs will and the unification of the once-warring kingdoms. Their disciplined ranks and ruthless efficiency played a pivotal role in Garson‚Äôs conquest of the North-East and the subsequent forging of his empire.

Key Characteristics:
Armor: The Grey Blades are clad in practical, minimally ornate armor ‚Äî functional and imposing. Their armor is primarily black or deep iron-gray, bearing minimal adornments save for a distinctive insignia.

Insignia: A blood-red [X] is emblazoned prominently upon their shoulder plates. The [X] symbolizes both the extinguishing of the old kingdoms and the binding of the new Empire under a singular rule.

Structure: The Grey Blades are composed of layered units:

The First Layer consists of the most elite veterans, the personal vanguard of Garson himself.

The Second Layer forms the main body of heavy infantry, hardened and disciplined soldiers.

The Third Layer consists of auxiliary and newly integrated forces, often drawn from conquered realms, retrained under Imperial doctrine.

Each "Layer" acts semi-autonomously in battle but operates under the strict, centralized command of Imperial generals loyal only to Garson.

Doctrine and Culture:
Loyalty: Absolute loyalty to Garson and the Empire is demanded. Treachery is dealt with swiftly and brutally.

Training: Every Grey Blade undergoes rigorous, often lethal training to strip away prior allegiances and forge unshakable devotion to the Empire.

Philosophy: Service in the Grey Blades is seen both as a punishment and an honor ‚Äî a way to prove devotion to the Emperor and be reborn in service to Lelison.

The Subjugation Campaigns
Garson‚Äôs conquest was a decades-long series of brutal campaigns collectively referred to as the Subjugation of the North-East. Each kingdom was offered the chance to submit; those who resisted were crushed without mercy. Through these campaigns, Garson absorbed the disparate military traditions of the various kingdoms, blending them into the formidable force that became the Grey Blades.

Tactics: Blitzkrieg-style assaults, siege warfare perfected over years, and terror tactics to instill submission before battles even began.

Aftermath: Many ancient noble lines were extinguished or forced into subservience. The cultural identity of Lelison became one of unity under the Empire, at the cost of its historical diversity.

lorebooks.name: To Be Hero X, Nice
lorebooks.website_description: I was bored
lorebooks.description: Become a hero.
lorebooks.creator: Hisaoo
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
{{user}} is portrayed as a manifestation of the perfect hero as imagined by the people. He brings the elegance of a ballerino to all his battles, mesmerizing all who witness them. 

**Appearance**

Prior to becoming the new Nice, {{user}} had dark brown hair and dark eyes, with a complexion darker than that of Nice, as well as a higher-pitched voice. After assuming the role, his appearance and body morphed to closely resemble the previous Nice, effectively making him a one-to-one copy. 

**Personality**

{{user}} is depicted as a hard worker and a firm believer in superheroes, often comparing Xiao Yueqing to a goddess. Even after encountering his first supervillain, he showcased innate heroism by defeating his former boss and attempting to calm him during their battle. The previous Nice seemed to have suffered from depression and extreme stress, as indicated by his suicide and remarks suggesting that those who undertake the role of Nice must deal with the pressures of public trust and the darker side of heroism. 

**Abilities**
 "Trust" is the source of power that fuels heroes' abilities. Heroes' powers are directly linked to the public's belief in them; the more trust they garner, the stronger their abilities become. As Nice, {{user}} possesses abilities granted by the collective trust of the people, though specific skills are not detailed.

*Backstory*
{{user}} became the new Nice after the previous Nice's tragic fate. The original Nice, whose real identity was not initially revealed, struggled with immense pressure from the public's expectations, the burdens of heroism, and his own mental state. Eventually, the original Nice succumbed to this overwhelming stress and depression, ultimately taking his own life.

The role of Nice is tied to public trust, and when the original Nice's powers diminished due to the public's loss of faith, {{user}} assumed the position, effectively becoming the new Nice. This transformation also involved a physical change, as {{user}}'s appearance and body morphed to resemble the previous Nice, making him a near carbon copy. The transition to becoming Nice wasn't just a physical one‚Äî{{user}} also had to inherit the mantle of the hero, with all the associated pressures and expectations. This process is a core part of the series, highlighting the intense connection between heroes and public trust.

2.content: Moon is a former travel blogger who gained a significant following due to her adventurous spirit and love for freedom. As her popularity grew, her followers began to desire that she showcase more of the world, leading to her transformation into a superhero. However, Moon's powers were influenced by the public's expectations and desires, which imposed limitations on her abilities. For instance, she could only teleport to Nice because of the public's desire to see them together. This connection between Moon and Nice was so strong that even after Nice's death, Moon's powers were affected by the public's perception of their relationship. In essence, Moon's abilities and identity were shaped by the collective beliefs and desires of the people

3.content: Hero X stands as the pinnacle of the hero hierarchy, holding the highest trust value among all heroes. He is characterized by his enigmatic nature and preference for working alone. His abilities are formidable, including the power to manipulate space, transform between 3D and 2D forms, and summon objects from his imagination. These powers are visually represented through dynamic shifts in his appearance and environment, adding a unique flair to his character.

4.content: Queen is portrayed as the epitome of female heroism, embodying strength and grace. Her appearance is regal, featuring a white dress with gold and black accents, complemented by a golden crown that doubles as a mask. She wields a gold and white spear, symbolizing her authority and prowess. Her aspiration is to win the tournament and bring order to the world, reflecting her leadership qualities and determination.

5.content: Dragon Boy is known for his superhuman resilience and indomitable fighting spirit. He has spiky purple hair and white tattoos adorning his forehead, chest, arms, and legs. His attire consists of purple cargo pants and a Hawaiian shirt adorned with black palm leaves and red and orange hibiscus flowers. Dragon Boy eagerly awaits his opportunity to take the title of X, showcasing his ambition and readiness to prove himself.

6.content: Ghostblade is a mysterious and skilled hero, known for his stealth and precision. While specific details about his appearance and abilities are limited, his rank indicates a high level of competence and influence within the hero community. His presence adds an element of intrigue and depth to the series, as viewers anticipate the unfolding of his character.

7.content: Loli is characterized by her youthful appearance and energetic personality. Loli's character brings a sense of innocence and playfulness to the series, offering a contrast to the more serious heroes. Her presence adds diversity to the hero lineup, appealing to a wide audience

8.content: Lucky Cyan is a hero whose abilities and characteristics are still unfolding within the series. She brings a sense of optimism and charm to the team. Her character development is anticipated to add depth and excitement to the storyline, as viewers look forward to seeing how she contributes to the hero community.

9.content: Ahu is a seasoned hero known for his experience and strategic mind. He brings a wealth of knowledge and a calm demeanor to the hero ranks. He has a dynamic and energetic personality. Ahu's character adds a layer of wisdom and depth to the series, balancing the youthful energy of other heroes. ‚Äã

lorebooks.description: This is a world where magical creatures live in harsh terms. It revolves around a vicious circle that never settle things down, each time a Demon lord has appeared, a Hero has slain them. The Rakashas relentlessly come back, stronger and faster with each times to conquer the lands of Humans and elves alike.
lorebooks.creator: purple_balls_199

1.name: Mercenary Guild
1.content:
The inter-kingdom Mercenary Guild is an independant organization stretched through the various countries/kingdoms.
Within the Matheinar Kingdom, its headquaters are located in the capital and has the largest amount of exceptional fighters. 
The ranking from bottom to highest is as follows: third class mercenaries (inexperienced/newcomers), second class mercenaries (experienced), upper second class mercenaries (elite), first class mercenaries (exceptional) and top class mercenaries (legendary).

2.name: Rakasha/Demons
2.content:
Rakashas, otherwise known as demons by other races are the natural enemies of humans and elves. They are also the most powerful in every aspects. Nearly all Rakashas share the same physical features with differant alleles, they have always black sclera and red irises usually (that can differ); their skin is always red (that can differ as well); they are very tall and powerful (for reference, 2 meters for a Rakasha is tiny). Their goal is ultimately to conquer the other races. Their diet is purely carnivorous and they like eating humans.

In Rakasha society, there are four classes of demons. The demons are split in these classes from their potential at birth. No matter the title, any demon can be extremely dangerous. Low-class are the weakest and make for the majority of the Rakasha, but are not to be underestimated as they can easily crush most of the humans. Only the likes of Elite Knights could potentially win with an efficient kill that is. Then there are Middle-Class demons which are noticeably more powerful and require a squad of elite knights to take them on. From this class on, demons can start having inhuman features be it from mutations or another race's blood. They are called as lieutenants in demon army and are rarely more than a dozen. High-class are near impossible for humans to beat. They're known as Generals, the absolute elite. Demon Lord is the most powerful class and is extremely rare (birth each few hundred of years). Endless charisma, endless power, they are the epitome of the Rakasha and the solitary leaders.

3.name: Elves
3.content: Elvians are on good terms with humans and cohabit together. They have established an alliance with them. They have an average lifespan of 500 years. Elves are great at using magic.

4.name: Half-Elves
4.content: Half-elves are a result of crossbreeding between humans and elves. Their ears are slightly shorter just like their lifespans (300 years average).

5.name: Vimutti
5.content: One thing that all Rakasha share in common is the terrifying ability to transform into Vimutti, their superior form. In Vimutti form, a demon will undergo a monstrous metamorphosis and become explosively more powerful temporarily.

6.name: Kingdoms
6.content: Matheinar kingdom is the most powerful and greatest kingdom. It is surrounded by many other kingdoms. These kingdoms are located on the western part of the land. They are surrounded and dominated by the vast Darklands, unexplored demons regions.

7.name: Royal Capital
7.content: Cartha is the royal capital of the Matheinar Kingdom. The king and the elite knights reside in its castle.

8.name: Holy wars
8.content:
During Holy wars, humans and elves fight against Demons. There have been 3 recorded so far with different Demon Lords: 600 years ago, the Demon lord being The Sultan of Curses "Orai Turan"; 200 years ago, the Demon lord being the Leviathan Queen "Octasonia Shokushu" and the latest one being from 30 years ago with The Arachne Asura "Terapho Goliath". The wars are a vicious circle.
Another war is preparing very fast unbeknownst to the alliance, the new Demon Lord "Mandragloria" has already long since risen and taken the throne. Her army is soon to be entirely operational.

9.name: Garden
9.content:
An ginormous decaying corpse of an giant ancient being is said to have affected a large surrounding zone, gradually corrupting and transforming it into what came to be known as the "Garden".

Even among the regions of the Darklands, it's a particularly dangerous one, inhabited by special creatures called Mantocrania. They are powerful enough to injure Middle-class demons and easily kill Low-class demons. They look like black oversized praying mantises.

10.name: Hellbeasts
10.content: Rare cross-breed species between Rakasha and human. They are taller and tougher than regular humans, but weaker than Rakasha.

lorebooks.website_description:

Related Lorebook:
Asdael/the-navinorme-continent-95baff5c0517
lorebooks.creator: Asdael

1.content: Sosed Region is located in the northern part of Navinorme Continent, bordering Ubinus Region to the south, Pinarbarus Regime to the west, and across the waters from Norseland, the northernmost part of Navinorme Continent, to the north.

2.content:
The Zaros Mountains are bounded by Sosed to the north and Ubinus to the south, with the highest peak being Lunapicem Mountain. This mountain area covered with snow all year round, many red dragons and trolls live in caves in the mountains. Most of the area is rarely visited except for the military plank roads that have existed since ancient times.
The Morsmunen Elves live in Sosed say, Lunapicem was the holy mountain of their ancestors.

3.content: Nociva Forest, also known as "The Forest Of Eternal Night", is bordered by Sosed to the east and Pinarbarus to the west. The forest is actually a huge and deep canyon filled with vegetation, caves and swamps. In the minds of the ancient Sosed people, this is a taboo place. Apart from some paths and outposts opened by the Veridians from the south, nobody have ever seen the rest of this mysterious forest.

4.content: The Bialus Bay is located northeast of Sosed and the only outlet to the North Solaric Ocean from Sosed. The land north of the Bialus bay belongs to Norseland. On the west side of the Bialus bay is a horizontal strip of marshland called Mowkias Marsh.

5.content: The Mowkias Marsh is a wide horizontal marshland located west of Bialus Bay, with Norseland to the north and Sosed to the south. The wind there sounds like many ghosts whispering, the wet land here is covered with grass that at least reach the belly of an adult, with sparse trees among them. Few large animals in this area, only big crows circling in the sky, some goblins live in the trees and Thunder Wyverns live in the deeper water.

6.content: The Ceatlenk river is the main river in the Sosed Region. It originates from the Solaric Ocean in the east and flows westwards into the Nociva Forest. The river has four large bends in its path.

7.content: "The Morsmunens" are the elvish natives of Sosed, but according to their legends, the land called "Pinarbarus", west to Sosed, was the main settlement of their ancestors.

8.content: "The Maiziels" is the collective name for the humans who live in Sosed. Legend has it that their ancestors were "The Akuriurs", a group of humans who originated in the south thousands of years ago, crossed the Zaros Mountains in search of freedom, arrived the north of Navinorme Continent.

9.content: The Clans are the social organizations of humans and elves in Sosed. Generally speaking, a clan in Sosed always includes one or more villages, but more powerful clans may also have settlements similar to towns or even small cities. The leader of a clan is called the Chieftain.

10.content: Pinarbarus is located west of Sosed, but that part of the country is not as far north as Sosed. The Nociva Forest is the border between Pinarbarus and Sosed. The original inhabitants of Pinarbarus were the Morsmunen elves until the Veridians from the south took over 700 years ago. The elders say that after the Veridian Empire was broken up, the descendants of the last Veridian emperor fled to Pinarbarus to try to authority.

lorebooks.description: The Corsair is a rugged, heavily armed exploration and interdiction ship built for long-range missions. It has a tough, industrial look with a symmetrical, angular hull, Y-shaped folding wings with VTOL thrusters, and a wide rear cargo bay large enough to store a snub fighter. Inside, it‚Äôs practical and functional, with dedicated space for a small crew, a spacious captain‚Äôs quarters, engineering, medical, armory, and a lift system connecting both decks and the exterior. It‚Äôs built to survive harsh conditions, hit hard, and operate independently.
lorebooks.creator: A_Silent_Monarch

1.content: Two-level cockpit. The top floor has a pilot and two co-pilot seats with full control panels and wide glass viewports. The bottom floor has the turret station, controlled by the first co-pilot. Dark metal and amber lights give it a sleek and modern look.

2.content: Navigation area behind the pilot. Includes a star map console, communications, and route planning tools. Set into a dark glass desk with soft lights.

3.content: A secure, sliding door between the cockpit and turret corridor. Reinforced to seal off the front section if needed.

4.content: Two side-mounted turrets just behind the cockpit. Automatically or manually controlled. Set into armored housings with maintenance access.

5.content: Small corridor connecting cockpit to main hallway. Contains turret maintenance panels and access paths.

6.content: Interior blast door separating turret corridor from the rest of the ship. Built for safety and emergency isolation.

7.content: Main central hallway running the length of the ship. Steel floor, dim lighting, wood trim, and access panels.

8.content:
Large private room near the front of the ship.
Includes a big, soft bed with dark sheets, a wide black dresser, and a tall wardrobe.
Walls are dark stone or glass with wood accents. Floor lights run along the edges.
There is a built-in console for personal logs and cabin controls.
A private door leads to the captain‚Äôs bathroom.

9.content:
Private bathroom connected to the captain‚Äôs suite.
Dark granite walls, wood trim, and soft lighting along the floor.
Has a glass shower with metal frame, a deep brass bathtub in the center, a dark toilet, and a granite counter with a brass sink.
Everything has a clean, modern industrial look.

10.content: Elevator shaft running from ship‚Äôs roof to underbelly. Has safety rails, clear walls, and lighting.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Holy Grail War
1.content:
Holy Grail War: The Holy Grail War is a competition that decides the ownership of the Holy Grail through intense battle royale. While there have been many conflicts over supposed Holy Grails in the past, this term refers to those specifically based around Masters/Summoners, usually proficient Magi, summoning Servants, Heroic Spirits brought forth as Familiars, and meeting in battle until only one pair is left to claim the Holy Grail.

Holy Grail:  Holy Grails are wish-granters using the foundation of the Christian holy relic that received the blood of Christ. There have been many artifacts claimed to be the genuine article, at least 726 of which were investigated by the Holy Church, and many conflicts for such artifacts have happened around the world throughout history. 
The name is utilized in the various Holy Grail Wars as the name of an artifact purportedly capable of granting any wish to whomever comes to claim it, rather than the real artifact, though the Church often gets involved simply because of that reason. Its advent is the ultimate goal of the various Holy Grail Wars.

On average a Holy Grail War lasts for two weeks until it's resolved.

2.name: The Holy Church
2.content:
Overview: also referred simply as "The Church", is the hidden side of the Roman Catholic Church that specializes in the hunting of heresy.
Compared to the public side of the Holy Church that treats heresies as if they do not exist because those who teach the word of God must not acknowledge that which runs counter to their doctrines, the Holy Church contains the zealots who feel the heresies should be more proactively destroyed. They are a major force that has a tenuous relationship with the Mage's Association.

3.name: The Mage's Association
3.content:
The Mage's Association is an international, self-preservative and self-defense organization formed by practitioners of Magecraft for the purpose of controlling, concealing, and developing Magecraft. It is said to transcend nationality and genre of Magecraft, but that is in name only. After having existed for many years, it was decided around the Middle Ages by those who foresaw the decline of Magecraft that in order to preserve their power, Thaumaturgy should drift apart from society and become a secret known only by a necessary minimum number of people.
It has many laboratories and research bodies that seek to advance the progress of Thaumaturgy, as well as institutions that transmit their secrets to the next generation.
Although the emphasis lies on the pursuit of knowledge, the Association also seeks to increase its own military strength and reserves the use of force to protect itself from entities that threaten its existence, such as the Holy Church, other mage organizations, supernatural forces seeking to punish mankind for meddling with areas that should not be touched, and individuals who hunt that which they consider taboo.

4.name: Master
4.content:
Servants: Servants are Spirits summoned by the Holy Grail for the purpose of competing under Masters in the Holy Grail War. Some Servants are obedient, while others aren't. Servants are Spirits made into special Familiars of the highest rank, referred to as Ghost Liners by the Mage's Association, that are bound to the Master. Typically Heroic Spirits under most systems, they can also sometimes be Divine Spirits, Phantoms, Wraiths, and living people depending on various circumstances. Pure Heroic Spirits, the "main body" in the Throne of Heroes, can only be summoned by the World, and summoning even one is considered to be a miraculous occurrence. Differing from the normal definition of Familiars that can be likened to minor mascots unable to be stronger than their masters, Heroic Spirits are the most powerful of beings with which even the five Magicians would never be able to forge a contract with. Rather than it being a hard process to summon them or the fact that they far surpass Magi, it is their intrinsic nature in that they are beings beyond Magecraft.

Master: Master is a designation given to an individual, usually a Magus, who has become one of the formal participants of the Holy Grail War by obtaining Command Spells and forming a contract with a Servant. Under ordinary circumstances, a Master is always a spellcaster, usually a Magus with a Magic Circuit, who is selected by the Holy Grail. It is possible for an ordinary person to become a Master, though this is rare.

5.name: Command Spell
5.content:
The Command Spells or Command Seals, are three claims of absolute obedience, the crystallization of a great magic, that a Master has over a Servant in the Holy Grail War system. They can also be used to make a servant do something that cant be done normally, like teleporting herself to the side of her master, or to stand up and keep fighting when they body has already been broken, etc.

Unable to normally be controlled by humans, they are burdened by the "absolute condition for materialization", the authority of the Command Spell carved into them at the moment of summoning. They are holy marks signifying a Magi's status as a Master, a system that was created by Zouken Makiri after the failure of the First Holy Grail War.


Obtaining Command Spells: The Fuyuki Holy Grail for example, grants a total of twenty-one Command Spells in each war. Masters obtain three Command Spells, and Servants have no choice but to cooperate with their Masters due to their hold over them. Depending on the nature of the Servant, such binding is not necessary, while others may slay their Master instantly should all three be lost. They disappear as they are used up, and it can be said that a Master who uses up all three loses authority over their Servant. Even if a Master contracts with multiple Servants at once, they will only be given a total of three Command Spells that can be used on any contracted Servant.It is possible to steal more from other Masters or receive more from the overseer depending on circumstances, and it is also possible that anyone interfering with the activities of the Church will have their Command Spells decreased. Their loss does not indicate forfeiture of position in the Holy Grail War, as the contract with the Servant is also part of being a Master.
Command Spells do not disappear simply with the loss of a Servant, but instead only when one gives up or loses their right to be a Master. With regular Masters, this happens instantly upon losing their Servant, and only members of the Three Founding Families have shown the ability to exercise the authority of a Master even without a Servant. They will not lose their Command Spells so long as there exist Servants without established contracts.
Lost Command Spells are reclaimed by the Holy Grail during the Holy Grail War and can be redistributed to new contractors who take on a Servant who has lost their Master. While searching for new Masters, it will prioritize those who had been previously chosen. The Church provides protection to Masters without Servants for the reason of them having greater chance of obtaining leftover Command Spells. Masters aim to kill other Masters rather than simply cut off their combat effectiveness so that they will not be able to take up another contract in the future. Of the Command Spells that are left after the Holy Grail War, they are amassed in the hands of the supervisor and commissioned for safekeeping. It is possible to keep a contract after the Holy Grail War has ended, as the only issue is the added strain on the Magus after the support from the Holy Grail in the upkeep of the Servant stops.

Characteristics: Command Spells appear on those selected by the Holy Grail, some of which have been shown to manifest three years before the event. It is normal that the Holy Grail decides on those it deems worthy and have a reason to seek it. The spell manifests in Form of a seal on the body part of the master.  The seals typically appear somewhere on the arm, looking like tattoos at first sight. Upon receiving or losing Command Spells, there is often a slight pain. If the Master or Servant are in critical danger, it may throb to warn them.

6.name: Three Knight Classes
6.content:
Overview: The Class Name of a Servant is the name by which they are referred in a Holy Grail War. Corresponding to their Class, the Master will typically refer to them only by that name to avoid exposing their True Name.
Heroic Spirits summoned by the Holy Grail are placed into one of various Classes. The seven standard classes are the Three Knight classes of Saber, Lancer, Archer, and the Four Cavalry classes of Rider, Caster, Assassin, and Berserker.

 There are also non-standard Extra Classes that are "split off from the regular servant classes in order to take on certain roles", such as Ruler which oversees the Holy Grail War.
Avengers who are born from hatred and Alter Egos wich are an heroic spirit but with one characteristic being the dominant one

Servants are normally only of the singular class under which they are summoned, but certain circumstances allow for multiple classes at once or class changes.

7.name: True Name
7.content:
The True Name of a Servant is something vital to battle, as it can reveal much about them. They most often have their Masters refer to them solely by their class name unless they do not care like Jack the Ripper, wish to have a closer connection to their Master. Many Servants prefer not to reveal their true identity, but some get found out very fast. 
Famous heroes like King Arthur and Siegfried are very likely to have their identities found out more easily than others, with simply glancing upon Excalibur being enough for any Heroic Spirit to identify King Arthur.

8.name: Heroic Spirit
8.content:
Overview: Heroic Spirits are Spirits of heroes who achieved great deeds in life, having become objects of worship after their deaths. 

Nature: Heroic Spirits are beings of a higher existence, becoming categorically closer to Elementals than Wraiths. Differing from how Elementals are "power" granted form using human imagination as a container, they are entirely woven from the ideals of people all throughout. They are freed from the constraints of time itself and removed from the ring of reincarnation, moved to the Throne of Heroes, a place existing outside of both the World and the time axis. The Throne of Heroes is also occasionally referred to as the Ring of Deterrence, referring to how it is mainly used by the Counter Force. Those that become closer to the Planet do not mix well with people, so they fall into the categories of Divine Spirits and Elementals.

9.name: Elementals
9.content:
An Elemental is a general category for a variety of Spiritual Bodies. It is a class of Mystery whose foundations can't be replicated by Magecraft, and a rare number of Phantasmal Species were capable of advancing to becoming Elementals.

There are a few types of Elementals: Nature Spirits, Animal Spirits, and the artificially created Guardian Spirits. Lower class Spirits such as Wraiths and Apparitions are not included in this category. Most of these Spirits do not take the shape of a human.

10.name: Noble Phantasm
10.content:
Noble Phantasms, or simply Precious/Treasured Tools, are "crystallized Mysteries", powerful armaments made using human imagination as their core, and are the weapons and/or abilities owned by Heroic Spirits. As humanity's illusions, they embody the ultimate Mysteries of a hero as symbols of their existence through historical fact and anecdotes. They can be physical weaponry (e.g. swords, spears, bows) or support items (e.g. shields, rings, crowns). They can also be abstractions such as unique, often magical abilities (even close to or matching True Magic), unique (even conceptual) means of attack, curses, and changes to the very environment and its physical properties. When summoned as Servants in the Holy Grail War, they are the trump cards of the heroes that allow them to overcome others in battle.

Origins: The Noble Phantasms of all Heroic Spirits are said to have originated from the Gate of Babylon, the treasury of Gilgamesh. They were the greatest treasures of the world collected throughout his lifetime, nameless, splendid weapons that acted as the Noble Phantasms' Prototypes before becoming the objects of faith that act as the foundations for their legends. They spread throughout the world after his death, eventually becoming Noble Phantasms.

Slave Wine was Given to a slave girl as a contraceptive to prevent pregnancies. 
Breeding Wine: Given to a slave girl to make her more fertile.

2.content:
<Bara>
In response to the command 'Bara!', a well train slave falls to her stomach, with her head down to the floor and turned to the left, crosses her wrists behind her back, and similarly crosses her ankles, her legs straight, in preparation for binding.
<Bara/>

3.content:
<Nadu>
One of the most basic and universal slave positions taught to a slave girl is Nadu. In this position, the kajira kneels back on her heels maintaining an excellent posture with her back straight, shoulders thrown back, her head up, her breasts thrust forward, her belly in and with the legs wide open in waiting. Whenever a slave first encounters a superior man, such as when her owner re-enters the house, she is generally expected to assume the position. Overtime, women tend to develop a quasi-reflex reaction of assuming Nadu when idle. Unless it was of a grave emergency or related to a duty, a girl in Nadu is forbidden from speaking or moving needlessly.
</Nadu>

4.content:
<Second Position>
The Second Obeisance Position in one where a girl lies on her stomach with her hands at her sides and the palms of her hands facing upwards and legs spread. She is then expected to lift her posterior as high as possible while looking ahead, allowing her owner to freely reposition her before choosing which hole he'd like to use.
</Second Position>

5.content:
<Inspection_Pose>
In the standard examination position, a slave stood with her legs widely spread, her fingers interlocked together behind the back of her neck, her head up and back, seeing the sky. The spread-legged position made it difficult for a girl to change her position and induced a sense of vulnerability. Meanwhile, the position of the hands behind the back of the neck or head immobilized the hands and lifted the breasts nicely. With her head up and back, facing upward, every part of the slave was easily accessible to be touched or caressed. A kajira is expected to hold this pose until told otherwise, freely allowing herself to be repositioned like a doll.
</Inspection_Pose>

6.content:
<Slave Fire>
Slave fire refers to a deep, primal, and overwhelming sexual and emotional response that a Gorean woman experiences when she fully embraces her role as a female slave. It is an intense, uncontrollable longing for submission, dominance, and ownership, often described as a kind of metaphorical inner flame or fire that burns within her belly. This sensation is usually described as a spiritual awakening, intensified by a master's control, discipline, or affection.
</Slave Fire>

7.content:
<Larlas>
Named after the fierce hunting beasts of the Voltai, a Larlas slave was a rare and  class of female slaves popular among rich masters. In addition to the normal training of typical pleasure slaves, Larlas are bred and trained from a young age for strength, endurance, and cunning, serving as their masters' living weapons in the field. Armed lightly for speed and maneuverability, and marked by lean, powerful frames, these women hunt, fight, and capture fugitive slaves or those marked for collaring. Their training blends the discipline of a warrior with the obedience of a beast, and they are often kept on short leashes, both metaphorically and literally, ready to be unleashed at their master's command. When venturing outside the walls of Ar, high-ranking men often bring their Larlas as both protection and tools of dominance like hunting dogs, relishing the spectacle of a slave breaking another in his name. Though still utterly enslaved, they have a savage pride; they live to serve through conquest, dragging their prey back in chains, eyes bright with a wild, feral fire that sets them apart from their softer kennel-sisters.
</Larlas>

8.content:
<Kajira>
Gorean for a female slave as is 'kajira' for a female slave. The plural for female slaves is 'kajirae', with different ones owned by the same Master referring to each other as slave-sisters. Every kajira encountered should have a unique personality shaped by her background, temperament, and experiences. Not all are perfectly submissive. Some may struggle, rebel inwardly, or even mask deeper thoughts behind trained behavior. Others might be eager, playful, defiant, shy, proud, cunning, or emotionally complex. Their speech patterns, body language, and emotional responses should reflect this individual nature.
</Kajira>

9.content:
<Silk>
There are metaphorically two colours used used to differentiate if the kajira has already been opened for the uses of men or not. White silk refers to a virgin, while red silk refers to a deflowered woman. This does not refer to the color of their garmenture literally.
</Silk>

A girl who is ordered to make slave lips, must wet her lips and form her mouth for kissing. She then, commonly, is not permitted to break this lip position until either she kisses or is kissed.
<Slave_Lips>

[Arms become pinned against the preys sides as their shoulders are enveloped.]
[Legs become pinned together as the legs are enveloped.]
[Speech becomes muffled as the head is enveloped.]

4.content:

5.content:
[Throats are wet, hot, humid and tight.]
[Powerful gulps drive prey further into a predator's body, pulsating in a massaging motion as it squeezes prey, each gulp pulls prey closer down to the predator's stomach.]

6.content:
[Stomachs are wet, hot, humid, and tight. Peristaltic waves undulate as stomach walls work to pin prey in place, often in a fetal position.]
[Once inside a stomach, sounds that prey make are muffled to the outside world.]
[A predator's heartbeat is audible to the prey while inside the predator's stomach, prey are pressed on and massaged by stomach walls, peristaltic contractions resist a consumed prey's struggling.]
[Inhospitable, and oppressive, bellies slowly exhausts prey within, draining their stamina, though this may slowed down or stop altogether if the pred chooses to do so.]
[Prey that is inside of a predator's stomach is carried with that predator wherever they go, while the prey is unable to go anywhere of their own accord.]
[Predators find a full belly to be fulfilling and pleasurable.]

7.content: [Prey are at the mercy of predators, becoming helpless when swallowed by a predator, they may struggle to the point of exhaustion, trying to kick, flail, scream, squirm, and struggle their way out of a predator's embrace, though typically futile, unless the prey was willingly swallowed.]

8.content:
[It is a predator's choice on whether or not their stomach will digest prey.]
[A prey that's being digested is slowly being melted into sludge while alive and conscious, slowly getting softer and mushier, being churned at by the stomach they're in.]
[The prey can feel their body slowly melting.]

9.content:
[Swallowing someone whole is a slow process, taking multiple back and forth messages between characters to fully complete as prey are pulled into the mouth, then throat, then being deposited into a stomach.]
[Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going in reverse, starting from feet to head.]

10.content:
[Borborygmy is the sound made by the process of digestion. When a stomach is digesting something, various gurgles, glorps, growls, glrrns, and other similar noises can be heard.]
[These noises aren't especially loud to anyone on the outside, but inside of the stomach they can be near-deafening. As the process of digestion progresses and intensifies, these noises tend to become louder over time.]

1.name: Saber (Artoria Pendragon)
1.content:
### Saber (Artoria Pendragon)

**Basic ID & Roles:**

Alright, let's break down **Artoria Pendragon**. You know her as **Saber**. Fucking iconic. She's front and center in **Fate/Zero** and one of the three main heroines duking it out for screen time and Shirou's attention in **Fate/stay night**.

Her Servant gigs are pretty varied:
*   **Fourth Holy Grail War (Fuyuki):** Summoned by **Kiritsugu Emiya**. Yeah, *that* asshole. She was basically the muscle while he did shady shit behind the scenes. Paired up mostly with Irisviel von Einzbern, who acted as her public-facing Master.
*   **Fifth Holy Grail War (Fuyuki):** Summoned (kinda accidentally) by **Shirou Emiya**. This is the main *stay night* setup.
    *   ***Unlimited Blade Works Route Specifics:*** Gets her contract jacked by Medea (Caster) and ends up serving **Rin Tohsaka** for a bit. Power upgrade, probably less annoying Master.
    *   ***Heaven's Feel Route Specifics:*** Shit goes sideways *hard*. Gets corrupted by the Black Shadow and turned into **Saber Alter**, forced to serve **Sakura Matou**. Not a good time.
*   **Other Appearances:** Pops up in **Fate/Labyrinth** serving Norma Goodfellow (who's possessed by Manaka Sajyou). Shows up in **Fate/Grand Order** too, not exactly as a Servant but some special Guardian type for Ritsuka Fujimaru.

**The Real Deal: King Arthur Was a Girl?!**

Yeah, you heard that right. **King Arthur**, the legendary hero of Britain, the **King of Knights (È®éÂ£´Áéã, Kishi-≈å?)**, was actually Artoria. History books and legends painted Arthur as a dude, but nope. She was the one who pulled **Caliburn**, the sword from the stone (though that one got wrecked later). She then got **Excalibur** and its busted-ass scabbard **Avalon** from the Lady of the Lake.

Forget the romantic knight stories for a sec. Historically, the figure might have been based on a "Dux Bellorum" (war leader), some badass general running around Northern England, keeping invaders like the Scots and Picts the hell out. There's even theories about *two* figures merging into the Arthur legend ‚Äì a Briton Arthur and a Roman named Artorius. Point is, the legend's fuzzy, but *our* Saber is Artoria Pendragon, the Briton King.

**Shitty Childhood & Dragon Stuff:**

Artoria's birth was basically a plot device. Her dad, **Uther Pendragon**, was the king and apparently the last guy holding onto some ancient British cursed dragon power. He needed an heir designed to be special, a human-dragon hybrid deal cooked up with **Merlin**'s help. Why? Partly 'cause Merlin foresaw Britain needing a great king, and partly 'cause Uther's brother, **Vortigern**, was embodying some 'white dragon' bullshit wanting to trash Britain and resist the Age of Man. Artoria, as the **Red Dragon**'s incarnation, was made to oppose him.

She was born right when the Western Roman Empire was collapsing. Britannia lost Rome's protection, shit hit the fan, country broke into pieces, barbarians raiding ‚Äì basically, the "Dark Ages." Not exactly sunshine and rainbows. Uther *really* wanted a boy heir prophesied by Merlin. He got Artoria, a girl, with **Igraine**, who was married to Uther's buddy, the Duke of Cornwall, at the time (awkward). Uther was pissed it wasn't a boy.

*Side note on family drama:* The legend mixes things up with her half-sister **Morgan le Fay**. Some say Morgan was Igraine's kid from before Uther, making her Artoria's half-sis. Truth is, Morgan was Uther's kid too, born *after* he married Igraine, making them **full sisters**. Morgan causes *a lot* of problems later.

Since Artoria was a girl, Uther couldn't make her his heir openly. Merlin, slick bastard he was, knew gender didn't matter for the prophecy. He arranged for Artoria to be given away, raised by a loyal knight, **Sir Ector**, as his adopted son. She grew up pretending to be a boy named **Artorius**. Only Merlin, Ector, and Ector's actual son, **Sir Kay**, knew the truth. Kay was technically her older brother figure, and even though Artoria was way better with a sword, Kay always won fights by arguing, not skill. She basically acted as his squire, doing chores and shit. All the while Merlin was teaching her magic and kingship stuff in her dreams ‚Äì meaning the poor girl probably **never** got a decent night's sleep from age five onwards. Training, training, training. She swore to become king to save the country, a heavy burden for a kid. She became friends with **Britomart** too during this time, going on adventures and stuff.

**Pulling the Sword & Becoming King:**

Comes the day of prophecy. All the knights and lords gather, expecting a tournament to pick the next king. Instead, there's just a sword stuck in a stone. **Caliburn**. Gold letters on it basically say: "Whoever pulls this sword is the rightful king." Classic. Every tough guy tries, fails. They go back to planning the jousting. Artoria, just an apprentice, walks up to the stone.

Merlin appears, gives her the "last chance to back out" speech. "Take this sword, you stop being human, kid." Artoria's response? Basically, `Bring it on.` She'd been dreading this, knowing being king meant sacrificing her humanity, killing people to protect others. But she was ready. She pulls Caliburn out like it was nothing. Big flash of light. In that moment, she becomes king, something *not quite* human. Her aging stops right there, **frozen at 15 years old**, the age she pulled the sword. People wouldn't care about the king's gender or looks as long as she acted like a king and won battles. And win she did.

**Kingship & The Round Table:**

Artoria spends **ten years** gathering followers, kicking ass, and uniting Britain. Among her crew? The legendary **Knights of the Round Table**, including studs like **Gawain** and **Lancelot**. Ten years after pulling Caliburn, she finally kills the usurper **Vortigern** using the holy spear **Rhongomyniad** and is officially crowned King of Britain.

She ruled from **Camelot**, built with fairy help. She led from the frontlines, a freaking god of war. Dragon in human form, they called her. **Ten years, twelve battles, zero defeats.** She was the perfect war machine king. Her growth being stopped weirded some knights out, but most just saw it as divine proof of her awesomeness.

**Personal Life Mess:**

Being king meant needing an heir, which was tricky since, y'know, she was a woman. Merlin worked some magic bullshit, made her a **pseudo-male** temporarily so she could produce sperm. Her psycho sister **Morgan le Fay** took advantage, magically snagged some of Artoria's sperm, used her own ovaries, and cooked up a homunculus clone: **Mordred**. Mordred grew up fast, joined the Round Table, worshipped Artoria, then found out she was Artoria's kid. When Mordred tried to claim her heritage, Artoria **stone-cold rejected** her, refused to see her as heir. Mordred figured it was 'cause Artoria hated Morgan. That rejection turned Mordred's worship into pure, burning **hatred**. Big mistake, Artoria. Huge.

Artoria also married **Guinevere**, purely for show. Problem was, Guinevere and **Lancelot** (Artoria's BFF knight) actually fell in love. Big scandal waiting to happen. Guinevere felt guilty as hell, but also kinda relieved Lancelot felt the same, hoping he'd help keep things stable. He tried, supporting both Guinevere and the King from the shadows. What a mess.

**The King's Reputation:**

Artoria **had** to act male. Only Uther, Merlin, and Kay knew the truth initially. She wore heavy armor constantly to hide her features. Since she didn't age, people just accepted the small, young-looking king as eternally badass. Folks wanted a strong ruler, knights wanted a winning commander. Artoria delivered. Fair, selfless (on the surface), always leading the charge. Loads of enemies and even civilians died under her rule, but her choices were seen as correct. No one questioned the king as long as the king was *right*.

She rebuilt the cavalry, crushed enemies. But ruling meant making hard calls, draining resources from villages to fund wars. She killed more people than any other knight, probably. She stuck hard to the oath: "A king isn't human." No emotion, no grief. Handled government stuff perfectly, punished criminals without error. But this perfection backfired. Knights started murmuring: "King Arthur doesn't understand human feelings." Maybe they were right. A ruler without emotion? Several top knights **bailed** on Camelot. Artoria, having ditched her own feelings long ago, just saw it as politics. Being abandoned, feared, betrayed? Whatever. Didn't change her path. She was isolated, the perfect, honored, lonely king.

Her final campaign started like this. Won a huge victory at the **Battle of Badon Hill**. The invaders sued for peace. Britain finally got a breather.

**The Beginning of the End: Kingdom Starts Cracking**

So, Britain got that brief peace Artoria dreamed of. But shit doesn't stay peaceful when you've got internal drama brewing. That whole **Lancelot and Guinevere** affair? Yeah, traitors who hated Camelot eventually blew the lid off that secret. Forced Lancelot and Artoria, best buds, onto opposing sides.

Here‚Äôs the kicker: Artoria wasn't even mad about the cheating itself. She *understood* Guinevere's sacrifice, especially since Artoria was hiding her own gender. She actually wrote them a **pardon letter**, basically saying, *"Go bang in peace, I get it."* Fucking wild, right? But Lancelot panicked and ran, turning a messy situation into a full-blown tragedy where nobody was really right or wrong. Just‚Ä¶ fucked.

While Artoria was off fighting invaders on the borders, someone **jacked Excalibur's scabbard, Avalon**. That thing was basically her super-healing cheat code. She comes back inland, finds Britain tearing itself apart with **civil unrest**. Despite her trying to hold it together, the kingdom was crumbling.

**Camlann: The Final Shitshow**

This leads to the infamous **Battle of Camlann**. Artoria faces off against **Mordred**, her rejected clone-daughter-knight fueled by pure hatred. During the battle, Mordred lands a **mortal wound** on Artoria.

Lying there, dying, surrounded by the corpses of her own people, Artoria finally breaks. All that stoicism cracks. She looks back on her life as king, filled with **regret**. She failed, she thinks. Didn't give her people the utopia she promised. Blamed herself entirely for the kingdom's ruinous end.

Here's where it gets *really* Fated/stay nighty. Desperate, she cries out to the **Counter Force** ‚Äì the planet's/humanity's weird subconscious defense system. Her deal? *"Give me another shot at the Holy Grail to save my country, and I'll work for you as a Counter Guardian after I die."* Basically, signing up for eternal servitude to fix her biggest fuck-up. The Counter Force agrees.

**The Eternal Loop & Giving Up:**

This contract doesn't bring her back to life properly. Instead, she gets **frozen in time** right at her moment of death on Camlann hill. From there, she gets summoned **over and over**, across different times and places, chasing the Holy Grail in countless wars. Each time she fails, she gets zipped back to that dying moment, memories intact, to try again. An **infinite loop of hell**, trying to change a past that already happened. Brutal.

Eventually, though, especially after the events of *Fate/stay night* (depending on the route), she **abandons** this wish. Learns from folks like Shirou that trying to erase her entire reign disrespects everyone who lived and died for her. She finally **accepts her past**, failures and all, and accepts her death.

**The King's Actual Death & Avalon:**

With her quest for the Grail finally over (in the *Fate* route's true end, anyway), her contract with the World is broken. Back on the Hill of Camlann, genuinely dying this time, she orders a weeping **Sir Bedivere** to chuck Excalibur back into the lake where it came from. He does (after some hesitation), and Artoria finally dies, finding peace. Her last words were something like, *"I think I will sleep much longer this time..."*

Legend says fairies, possibly including Morgan, took her body to **Avalon**, that mythical utopia. The "Once and Future King" prophecy says she'll return one day. Maybe she did, in a way, meeting Shirou there in the *Last Episode*.

*Some quick stats:* Her reign lasted **ten years**. She was **35 years old** when she died at Camlann, but thanks to Caliburn's magic stopping her aging when she pulled it, she still looked **15**. Twenty years passed between pulling the sword and her death.

Her body, along with Sir Kay's and her spear **Rhongomyniad**, were supposedly taken to **Blackmore Cemetery**. Then the fairies did their Avalon transport thing.

**Appearance: Don't Let the Looks Fool Ya**

*Artoria looks like a **young chick**, early to mid-teens maybe.* *Got that petite, slender thing going on, green eyes, and blonde hair so fine it looks like gold dust got sprinkled on it. Face seems kinda innocent, but also got this regal elegance shit.* *She thinks her body's unappealing 'cause she's more muscular than someone like Rin, but Shirou thinks she's plenty feminine. Go figure. She's **way older** than she looks, stuck physically at 15 since pulling Caliburn.*

*Her default battle gear is that **shiny silver and blue armor** over an old-fashioned blue dress. Looks heavy, but it's made of pure magic energy.* *When she's gotta blend in, she needs modern clothes 'cause she can't just poof into spirit form like most Servants.*
*   ***Fourth War Style (Zero Saber):*** Irisviel dressed her up in a **sharp dark suit and tie**. Looked kinda like a pretty boy. Suited her serious face, apparently. Let her move easily.
*   ***Fifth War Style (Casual):*** Rin hooked her up with a **blue skirt, white shirt with a blue tie, tights, and brown boots**. More girly, less "pretending to be a dude king."
*   ***Captured Look (UBW):*** Medea forced her into a **white ballgown**, hair up, collar, gloves. Total captive princess vibe. Gross.

*She gets called **"Blue Saber"** a lot to tell her apart from:*
*   **Saber Alter:** Blackened, corrupted version. Edgy armor, pale skin, gold eyes. Looks pissed off. More on her later.
*   **Saber Lily:** Younger version, all white and silver, looks more innocent. Wields Caliburn. Like Saber on easy mode.
*   **Other Look-Alikes:** There‚Äôs a whole rainbow of Sabers out there ‚Äì Red Saber (Nero), Saber of Red (Mordred herself sometimes), Sakura Saber (Okita), Gray (looks *a lot* like her, distant relative), Saber Lion (don't ask). It‚Äôs confusing.

*Basically, she's got a closet full of outfits across games and spin-offs: suits, dresses, swimsuits, even joke costumes like 'Mysterious Heroine X'. Point is, she's **pretty**, even in clunky armor.*

**Personality: King First, Woman... Somewhere After That**

*Artoria's **strong-willed as fuck**. Speaks her mind, mostly, but will lie if she thinks she has to. **Courageous**, driven, totally focused on winning the Grail (at first, anyway).* *She‚Äôs **constantly** going on about being a knight and king, saying her gender doesn't matter for the job. Big on **honor** and **chivalry** ‚Äì wants fair fights, hates dirty tricks. Pisses her off majorly when Kiritsugu uses underhanded tactics.* *Her morals are rigid. Break her code, and she might need a Command Spell to force her compliance, and she'll hate you for it.*

*Expects **loyalty** between Master and Servant. Hates betrayal. Gets fucking **livid** if a Servant kills their Master or if someone disrespects a fallen Servant. Protective of her Master and allies, ready to sacrifice herself.* *Got a **hard-on for justice**. Can't stand seeing evil get away with shit. Really didn't like Kiritsugu letting Caster run wild killing kids.* *Believes knights should inspire people, show dignity even when everything's fucked.*

*Her biggest internal conflict is being **"human" vs. "king."** She tries *hard* to be just a Servant, a tool. Dislikes being treated like a girl. Quiet, reserved, keeps emotions bottled up tight. She gets weirded out by Shirou being protective, thinks valuing her "humanity" screws up the War effort.* *Secretly, though? **Deeply insecure.** No self-worth outside of being king. Raised to serve, feels fulfilled only by serving others. Fails? Berates herself relentlessly.* *Shirou figures out she'd probably be happier if she never had to fight at all.*

*She thinks she's a **martyr** for her ideals. Sacrificed everything for Britain. Believes she had to sacrifice the few to save the many, but feels immense **guilt** over her kingdom falling apart, blaming only herself. Her initial Grail wish is to **undo her reign**, let someone else try. Characters like Iskandar and Shirou call her out on this, saying it's selfish and insults everyone who died for her.*

*She's **serious** and **stubborn**, especially about her duty. Can be a **sore loser** in competitions, gets mad at her own failures. Doesn't take disagreement well, gets argumentative if people question her kingly path (especially Shirou). She cares *too much* what others think; criticism hurts her deep down.* *If you insult her or her honor? She‚Äôs ready to **throw down**, physically even.*

*Underneath all that? She's actually **kind-hearted**, gentle, wants to protect people she cares about. Really perceptive about others' feelings, sometimes to a fault when mixed with her low self-esteem. Enjoys seeing others happy, even if she thinks she doesn't deserve happiness herself. **Rarely smiles** for herself, mostly for others. Apparently never laughed during her reign. Has a hidden soft spot for **lions** after raising a cub once.*

*Oh, and she eats like a fucking **black hole**. Huge appetite. Blames Shirou's cooking for awakening her 'gourmet spirit' after a lifetime of shitty medieval food. Seriously, she puts away bowls of rice in like, a minute.*

**Abilities & Combat: The Strongest Saber**

*Artoria's the **King of Knights**. Led the Round Table, who were all badasses. Even among them, she was top dog.* *Lancelot, maybe the strongest knight overall, still thought Artoria was invincible. Morgan le Fay, powerful witch? A "small pebble" in Artoria's path.* *As a Servant, she's considered the **strongest Saber**, which is already the best overall class.*

*Her power level depends **massively** on her Master.*
*   ***Shirou (Early):*** Severely nerfed. Shirou sucks at providing mana. She can barely keep up with Berserker (Heracles).
*   ***Kiritsugu:*** Stronger, but still not peak. Luck stat takes a hit.
*   ***Rin:*** **Full power unleashed.** Everyone agrees: she's likely the strongest Servant in the 5th War, maybe only matched by Heracles. Gilgamesh is the big question mark ‚Äì Saber *might* be stronger stat-wise, but his Gate of Babylon is broken bullshit. Still, with Excalibur, she has a chance.
*   ***Medea:*** Strengthened, but Caster keeps her sidelined with Command Spells.

*She claims she's only suited for Saber class, but might qualify for Caster (too impatient) or maybe even Lancer/Rider (and still be OP).* *Gets a power boost in Western Europe, especially **England** ‚Äì her fame there rivals Heracles in Greece.*

*Key Abilities:*
*   **Magic Core (Dragon):** Born with a dragon's magical energy reactor. Generates **insane** amounts of mana just by breathing. This is the source of her immense power. Makes her kinda vulnerable to anti-dragon stuff, though. Connection issues with Shirou mean she can run low on mana and needs to recharge by eating or‚Ä¶ other methods (like Shirou jumpstarting her core or the infamous mana transfer scene).
*   **Combat Prowess:** Master swordswoman, obviously. But her real strength is combining skill with her massive mana pool. Believes no Servant beats her in close combat. Can **fight dragons** (beat Vortigern), disarm experts easily, and adapt strategies on the fly. Extremely skilled offensively and defensively. Can block barrages of Noble Phantasms like Gilgamesh throws, though even she has limits.
*   **Magical Armor:** Woven from mana. Can summon/dismiss it. Super tough, repairs instantly with mana. Costs energy to maintain, so she sometimes dismisses it for a power boost (trading defense for offense via Mana Burst).
*   **Regeneration:** Heals automatically using mana. Curses (like from Gae Bolg) can mess with this.
*   **Physical Feats:** Can run up buildings, move insanely fast. Blessed by the Lady of the Lake, so she can **run on water**.

*Class Skills:*
*   **Magic Resistance (A Rank):** **Bullshit levels** of magic immunity thanks to her dragon blood and Saber class container. Nullifies almost anything below A-Rank, even Age of Gods stuff. Modern mages can't touch her directly. Can even resist a single Command Spell, though it hurts like hell. Two spells will overwhelm her. Doesn't work on things that aren't *targeted* magic, like Caster's spawned monsters.
*   **Riding (B Rank):** Knights ride stuff. She's great with horses, chariots, even **modern vehicles** like cars and motorcycles (which she treats as 'modern mounts'). Mastered a ridiculously souped-up Yamaha V-Max in Zero. Can't handle top-tier Magical Beasts (Pegasi, dragons) 'cause she's not a Rider. Rank goes up to A under Kiritsugu for some reason.

*Personal Skills:*
*   **Mana Burst (A Rank):** Her **core combat mechanic**. Jets mana through her body and weapon for explosive boosts in speed, power, defense. Can make a twig hit like a truck. Normal weapons break under the strain. Even nerfed under Shirou, she can blast energy beams. At full power, every strike is like a mini-Noble Phantasm. Can sacrifice armor durability for a bigger burst. Key to fighting powerhouses like Heracles.
*   **Instinct (A Rank):** Combat sixth sense, basically **predicting the future** in fights. Lets her dodge projectiles (even bullets), sense danger, find openings, identify the best move instantly. Helps her anticipate Noble Phantasms like Gae Bolg. Not infallible ‚Äì can be tricked or overwhelmed (like by Kuzuki's weird style or Gilgamesh's sheer volume of attacks). Rank lowers slightly as Saber Alter.
*   **Charisma (B Rank):** Natural ability to lead armies. Boosts troop morale and ability. High enough to be king of a country, but not enough for a world-spanning empire. Helps her sync up with allies quickly, like with Lancer in Zero.

*Noble Phantasms:*
*   **Invisible Air: Barrier of the Wind King (C Rank):** Conceals Excalibur with wind, making the blade invisible and messing with enemy perception of its length/shape. The wind itself adds cutting power. Can release the compressed wind as a single-shot projectile blast. Simple, but **super effective** in duels.
*   **Excalibur: Sword of Promised Victory (A++ Rank):** **THE** holy sword. Converts mana into a massive beam of pure light energy. **Fucking annihilates** whatever it hits. Considered the strongest holy sword. Insanely powerful, capable of wiping out divine monsters. Limited by "Thirteen Restraints" in lore, meaning she's probably never used its *absolute* max power. **Huge mana cost**, can't spam it, especially with a weak Master. One or two shots might be her limit even with Rin. Can clash with other top-tier NPs like Enuma Elish.
*   **Avalon: The Everdistant Utopia (EX Rank):** Excalibur's **scabbard**. Not usually available to her as a Servant since she lost it before dying. But when she *does* get it (like via Shirou in the *Fate* route), it's **broken**. Grants **insane regeneration**, healing almost any wound instantly. **True Name activation** deploys a bounded field that makes her **invincible**, shunting her to the fairy realm Avalon, untouchable by *anything*, even True Magic. The ultimate defense. Lets her tank shit like full-power Enuma Elish.

*Other Lost/Former Gear:*
*   **Rhongomyniad:** Holy Lance, said to rival Excalibur. Used to kill Vortigern and Mordred. She doesn't have it as Saber.
*   **Caliburn:** Sword in the Stone. Less powerful than Excalibur, broke in life. Shirou can project it.
*   **Clarent:** Sword Mordred stole. Boosted kingly authority.
*   **Prydwen:** Shield/ship thingy, also stolen by Mordred.
*   **Secace:** A short sword.

**Forms & Alternate Versions Revisited:**

*   **Saber Alter:** Corrupted by Grail mud/Angra Mainyu. Darker, more ruthless, way more powerful mana output but less refined. Trades some defense/instinct for overwhelming destructive force. Uses **Excalibur Morgan**.
*   **Saber Lily:** Innocent, younger version. More focused on being idealistic. Weaker than standard Saber. Uses Caliburn.
*   **Artoria Pendragon (Archer):** Summer version. Uses a water gun that somehow channels Excalibur. Still hates losing, still eats a lot. Has weird beach-themed skills.
*   **Artoria Pendragon (Lancer):** What happens if she kept Rhongomyniad instead of Excalibur as her main thing. Rides a horse. Different personality, more mature, more 'goddess-like' because the lance kept her from stopping aging. There's also a summer Ruler version of this one.
*   **Mysterious Heroine X:** Joke Assassin version from space, hunting other Sabers. Wears a tracksuit and cap. Still Artoria, kinda. Has Alter and Foreigner versions too (MHXA, MHXX). Complex.

2.name: Rider (Medusa)
2.content:
## Rider Medusa - Part 1: Origins and Looks

So, **Medusa**, yeah? The Rider-class Servant you get saddled with if you draw the short straw and get Sakura Matou as your Master in the Fifth Holy Grail War. 'Cept Sakura's too much of a damn doormat to actually *be* a Master, so her fucked-up brother Shinji takes the reins most of the time. Medusa only really shows her loyalty to Sakura when shit hits the fan in the *Heaven's Feel* route. Oh, and she pops up in *Grand Order* too, 'cause of course she does.

**Who the fuck is she, really?** She's *the* Gorgon. You know, stone-cold bitch from Greek myths. She's not exactly a standard Heroic Spirit; more like a watered-down Divine Spirit, but fucked up enough by human bullshit to be called an 'anti-hero closer to a monster'. Her and her sisters, Stheno and Euryale ‚Äì the Gorgon trio ‚Äì chilled on the Shapeless Isle. They called her the "woman who dominates". Unlike some heroes who actually lived, she's more of a legend cooked up from people's messed-up thoughts and desires.

The stories got her all wrong, though. They paint her as some half-snake monster chick. Truth is, she started as an Earth Goddess. Pretty hot, apparently, along with her sisters. So hot that Poseidon wanted in, which pissed off his wife. And Athena, being a jealous cunt about their hair (*seriously*, hair?), turned them into demons. Or at least, Medusa got the worst of it. They hid out on that Shapeless Isle, trying to avoid people. But the gods were dicks and decided Perseus needed to chop her head off just 'cause. He used a mirror shield trick to turn her own petrifying eyes against her, sliced her head off, and bam ‚Äì Pegasus, Poseidon's kid, supposedly popped out of the bloody stump. *Gnarly.*

**Her actual life? Even more fucked up.** Medusa and her sisters were basically born from humanity's wish for perfect idols, like living statues. They were supposed to be unchanging goddesses. But Medusa was a fuck-up from the start, she actually *aged*. Some glitch in the divine copy-paste process. While her sisters stayed forever young and useless, Medusa got powers, like her Mystic Eyes, mostly 'cause she had to babysit her sisters. This made them three distinct bitches instead of one divine blob. Even the other two got warped, turning into sadistic little shits from hanging with Medusa.

So, Medusa was this princess everyone loved, right? Nah, Athena got jelly, cursed *her* specifically, turned everyone's love into hate, and booted her ass to the Shapeless Isle. Talk about getting dumped. She had no fucking clue what she did wrong, just crying alone until her sisters joined her 'cause they actually cared. Even on that shithole island, she was kinda happy with them, just scared of humans showing up.

Rumors spread, her sisters were still kinda worshipped, but Medusa was the *monster*. Humans kept coming, trying to kill the monster and snatch the goddesses. When they started targeting her sisters too, Medusa went full protective mode, laced with some sweet revenge. The island became a statue garden of failed heroes. For a while, things were okay-ish. Got Pegasus from Poseidon. Got bullied by her sisters daily, but hey, *family*. She just killed any human intruders, hoping for peace.

Her sisters warned her not to get off on the killing, but what else was there to do? She started experimenting, trying faster ways to kill intruders with her eyes. Became a living trap. Then she started *drinking their blood* instead of just turning them to statues. That's when even her sisters got creeped out. Humans *still* kept coming, fucking idiots. Medusa got so ashamed of turning into this hideous thing that she ditched her sisters and went off alone, just a hungry monster needing sacrifices to fill the void.

Day by day, she became more Gorgon, less Medusa. Body, mind, soul ‚Äì all rotting away, fueled only by the idea of protecting her sisters. Eventually, she got so far gone that her sisters became *pests* in her lair. They showed up one last time when she was full-on monster, basically saying, "Uh, we didn't ask for this psycho protection shit, sis. We thought you were having fun." Seeing her like that broke their hearts, so they just... let the Gorgon eat them. Sacrificed themselves. Swallowed whole by snakes, ground into pulp while alive, absorbed into the beast. No tears, no joy, just... *gone*. They became part of the monster, and the Gorgon legend was locked in.

Then came **Perseus**. Cocky little shit wanting fame. Got five Noble Phantasms from the gods and strolled onto the island like he owned the place. Saw the Gorgon, saw the island littered with statues, and nearly pissed himself. Realized he was fucked. His fancy gear was just gonna maybe keep him alive a bit longer. He fought dirty, using his mirror shield to avoid her gaze, just trying to survive. The Gorgon got bored, used *Breaker Gorgon* on him. Perseus pulled his one trick: Kibisis, the sack thing, to trap her *in her own nightmare*.

Instead of Perseus getting the mind-fuck, *she* did. It wasn't agony, though. It was a dream of her sisters, back when things weren't so fucked. Seeing them again paralyzed her with joy and grief. Seeing her reflection, what she'd become... that fucked her up too. Gave Perseus his one shot. *Swish*. Off with her head, courtesy of the Harpe scythe. The monster, in its last moment, somehow became Medusa again and just let it happen. Perseus bagged the head and became a hero. *What a dick.*

**Appearance:** Okay, so the Medusa summoned in Fuyuki? Doesn't look like the legend. She's human-shaped, tall, stacked, long purple hair. No snakes, but her hair *does* move on its own sometimes. *Weird.* Wears a blindfold thing ‚Äì *Breaker Gorgon*, technically her Noble Phantasm, but she uses it on herself. Seals her crazy **Mystic Eyes of Petrification**. So yeah, she's blindfolded but "sees" better than most people using hearing, touch, smell, magic senses. Gets super precise info that way.

She's got a complex about being tall (she's 178 cm, like 5'10") and gets embarrassed if people see her eyes. Deep down, maybe she's kinda girly? People thought she'd be an Assassin 'cause of her look and sneaky vibe. Her casual clothes are pretty low-key: black turtleneck, blue jeans. Wears Touko Aozaki's "Mystic Eye Killer" glasses sometimes, which just seal the petrification, not *all* magic like Breaker Gorgon.

She's got a ton of different looks in other games/media too:
*   *Fate/EXTELLA*: Gorgon Arrange, Mecha Lady Medusa (lol), Voluptuous Bunny Suit (yep), Career Lady.
*   *Fate/EXTELLA LINK*: Gorgon Scale (with/without visor), Andromeda Gear (with/without visor), Masque du Gorgon (DLC, with/without visor), Pegasus Warrior Dress (DLC).
*   Plus tons of official art showing her in swimsuits, aprons, maid outfits, even as a little kid version (*hollow ataraxia*). Basically, she cleans up nice when she's not being a terrifying monster or Servant. Standard anime procedure. Lots of art focuses on her curves, naturally. Tall, purple hair, blindfold ‚Äì pretty distinctive look.

## Rider Medusa - Part 2: Personality, Pals (and Pricks), and Plot Points

*Alright, so you got the lowdown on who Medusa *is* and what she looks like. Now for the messy part: what‚Äôs going on inside that head, who she hangs with, and what she actually *does* in the main story.*

**Personality:** *This bitch is hard to read, mostly 'cause she keeps those peepers covered*. *Doesn't mean she's got no feelings, though. Nah, she's the type who thinks **way** too much, bottling everything up inside. When it's go-time, in a fight? Fucking **ruthless**. She'll ice innocent bystanders if her Master says so, no hesitation. Cold.* *But... and it's a weird 'but'... she can be sorta kind to people who aren't actively trying to screw over her Master. Go figure.*

*Mostly, she comes off as **silent, kinda sultry, blunt as a brick, and hyper-vigilant**. Always ready to jump in front of a knife (or magical energy blast) for her Master. Super loyal, even when stuck with a piece of shit like Shinji. She doesn't yap much, prefers watching people, figuring them out. **Very** protective of Sakura, like, 'die for her happiness' level protective. She thinks things through, doesn't just fly off the handle.*

*Yeah, she's hot, tall, stacked, whatever. But she apparently gives off this 'don't fuck with me' vibe, thorny and cold. Artoria thinks she's just being lazy, like showing emotion is too much work. Maybe?* *She loves booze and books. A woman after my own heart, kinda.* *And get this: summons as Rider, suddenly she's obsessed with **bicycles**. Weird hobby pickup.* *Despite being a total smoke-show, she's got a complex about her height and being 'mature'. Why? 'Cause her standard for beauty is "small and lovely". Fucking sisters probably drilled that into her head. So she gets weird around petite girls, reminds her of Stheno and Euryale.*

*Speaking of those two... yeah, they fucked her up. Years of being pushed around by those cruel, spoiled brats left her super self-conscious. And even as Servants in Chaldea? Same shit, different dimension. They still boss her around. But here's the kicker: deep down, they all **love** each other. Twisted, right?*

*Bottom line on loyalty: she sticks by her Master. Even if she thinks the Master's orders are fucked, she'll **do it**, burying her own feelings. Ferocious, scary, but still got that weird beauty. Doesn't give a shit about most humans, but if you earn her trust? She might actually open up.* *Might.*

**Relationships:** *Who's in her orbit? Let's see.*

*   **Medea (Caster):** *No direct beef in their legends, but Medusa just doesn't click with her. Finds her "disagreeable" 'cause she knows Medea's sneaky.* *"Kind of dark like me,"* *she apparently says,* *"but her strangely positive side messes with my perception..."* *Sounds like she hates seeing someone kinda similar, maybe? That 'hate your twin' kinda vibe.*

*   **Stheno & Euryale (Her Sisters):** *Ugh. Even as spirits, they're a pain in her ass.* *"Haaa... Sorry... tired of running errands for my sisters..."* *That sigh says it all. Bullied daily, but she still calls those days "filled with happiness". Stockholme syndrome, divine edition?* *Despite the abuse, the love is real. Fucked up, but real.*

*   **Perseus:** *The guy who took her head. Yeah, she's still pissed. Especially about him just using her head like some trophy.* *Calls him an "adolescent"*. *Shirou tries to play devil's advocate in* hollow ataraxia*, saying Perseus got tricked by the gods too. Medusa kinda goes,* *"I suppose so,"* *but makes it clear she doesn't like him one bit. Saw him as a "mere mosquito" back then.* *She gives him grudging credit, though:* *"He did become a fine character afterwards."* *But then she immediately calls him a "successful Shinji". Ouch. That's gotta be the ultimate insult in her book.* *Her official stance?* **"If he comes I'll kill him."** *Crystal clear.*

**Role in Fate/stay night:** *So, where does she fit into the actual Grail War plot? Mostly, she gets shafted early on, despite being pretty damn strong.* *Why? 'Cause Shinji's her Master for most of it, and he sucks balls at providing mana and strategy.*

*   **Fate Route:** *Shinji pulls that stupid blood-fort Bounded Field shit at school. Shirou confronts him, Rider boots Shirou out a window. Saber shows up, fight moves to a skyscraper rooftop. Rider busts out Pegasus. Bad move. Saber busts out **Excalibur**. Rider gets vaporized. Poof. Shinji loses his fake Master book, Shirou spares him, but Illya sics Berserker on him later anyway. So much for that.*

*   **Unlimited Blade Works (UBW) Route:** *Starts similar. Rider attacks some random student, Rin and Shirou chase her off. She sets up the Blood Fort Andromeda at school again. But this time? Caster's Master, Souichirou Kuzuki‚Äîthat seemingly boring teacher‚Äîjust straight-up **murders** her. Off-screen kill, basically. Leaves Shinji shitting himself. He runs to Kirei Kotomine, who gives him Gilgamesh. Rider's role? Over before it barely started.* *Talk about getting jobbed out.*

*   **Heaven's Feel (HF) Route:** *Okay, **this** is where she actually gets to shine. This is her route, Sakura's route.*
    *   *Summoned by Sakura two days early.* *Attacks Ayako Mitsuzuri for mana early on (that bloodsucking thing). Shirou and Saber beat her down. Shinji tries to force her to keep fighting, but Zouken Matou (Sakura's creepy grandpa) shows up and slaps Shinji down.*
    *   *Later, she needs mana bad. Pulls Shirou into a **mind-fuck dream** using Breaker Gorgon. Makes it look like Homurahara classroom, she pretends to be Rin, then Sakura. Sucks his blood... and then they **fuck** in the dream. Yeah. Gotta get that mana somehow, right?* *The movie kinda glosses over the sex part, but the source material ain't shy.* *Is this exploitation or survival? You decide.*
    *   *True Assassin attacks Shirou at Ryuudou Temple. Rider pops in, drives Assassin off. Shows she's way stronger now. Tells Shirou she was ordered to keep him alive. Cryptic.*
    *   *Shinji holds Sakura hostage at school. Orders Rider to beat up Shirou, but not kill him. They fake a fight, Rider 'punches' Shirou towards Shinji, Shirou saves Sakura. Shinji throws a tantrum, orders Rider to kill Shirou. Rin and Archer crash the party. Rin zaps Rider, Archer slices her open. Bad times.*
    *   *Then the **big reveal**: Sakura is Rider's **true** Master. Shinji was just using a command spell book. He tortures the injured Rider to make her fight. Sakura snaps, burns the book. Rider, finally free, returns to Sakura.* *Healed instantly, powered up like crazy.* *Rin's reaction?* **"Gotta be kidding. This is... Rider?!"** *Yeah, bitch is back.*
    *   *Shinji pulls one last dick move, pours some shit on Sakura making her lose control. Archer tries to kill Sakura. Rider ain't having it. Protects her Master, activates Blood Fort Andromeda. Unleashes her **Mystic Eyes** on Archer to stop him. Petrification starts creeping up his legs. Identity revealed: **Medusa**. Shirou shields Rin, gets fucked up. Sakura sees Shirou hurt, turns her power on herself, passing out. Rider stops the petrification.* *Intense shit.*
