    *   *Shirou agrees to protect Sakura, so Rider becomes his ally. They go to warn Illya about 'The Shadow'. Too late. Archer tells Rider to transplant his arm onto Shirou (!!) before he fades.*
    *   *Rider has a heart-to-heart with Shirou, basically asking if he'll stick with Sakura no matter how bad it gets. Needs to know her Master is safe.*
    *   *Shirou ditches his hero ideals for Sakura. But Sakura, trying to be noble or whatever, confronts Zouken alone and uses her last Command Spell to order Rider to stay back and protect Shirou. *D'oh!** *So Rider's sidelined for the final bits against Dark Sakura/Angra Mainyu, mostly.* *Her loyalty tested right to the end.*

*So yeah, Heaven's Feel is where Medusa gets her development, her badass moments, and her loyalty truly shown. The other routes? She's basically cannon fodder or an early obstacle. Kinda shows how much a Master matters, huh?*

### *Rider Medusa - Part 3: Killer Moves, Divine Heritage, and Cameos*

*So, how does Medusa actually **fight**? When she‚Äôs not getting jobbed out by plot convenience, of course.* *She‚Äôs originally that snake-haired monster from Greece, right? Eyes that turn dudes to stone. Perseus slicing her head off ‚Äì classic stuff. But here's the twist: she started as an Earth Goddess. That makes her closer to a **Divine Spirit** than your average Heroic Spirit. Still, she got twisted into an anti-hero, damn near a monster. She‚Äôs got that **monster attribute**, which makes her bad news for heroes known for slaying beasts, like C√∫ Chulainn. Being an old goddess gives her a weird connection to the earth; she can feel Fuyuki's leyline getting messed up. Good radar, huh?*

***Combat Style:*** *Medusa‚Äôs a beast when it comes to using her Noble Phantasms ‚Äì she‚Äôs got a surprising number of tricks up her sleeve, more than most Servants. Super versatile.* *But she‚Äôs no slouch in close combat either. That **Monstrous Strength** skill combined with her **insane Agility** makes her deadly up close. She and Lancer (C√∫ Chulainn) are the fastest fuckers in the Fifth War. Medusa‚Äôs got better average speed, like a bullet zipping around. Lancer‚Äôs got the faster burst speed, like countering attacks instantly while standing still. If they fought? Tough call. Rider‚Äôs got tricks, but Lancer‚Äôs got runes for protection and he‚Äôs a pro monster killer, so Medusa would have a rough time.*

*Against someone like EMIYA (Archer)? Bad matchup for both. They‚Äôd probably play it safe. EMIYA‚Äôs technically more skilled, better at mid-range with his bow. But Medusa could just petrify his arrows, maybe? If Archer pulls out Unlimited Blade Works? Medusa answers with **Bellerophon** (her Pegasus Noble Phantasm) and probably flattens him. It really comes down to whether Archer‚Äôs Rho Aias shield can block that Pegasus charge. It‚Äôs **that** close.* *So yeah, overall, she‚Äôs definitely hanging with the big boys like Lancer and Archer in terms of raw power.*

*Now, here‚Äôs the catch you saw in the story bits: most of the time, she‚Äôs nerfed. Stuck with Shinji means shit mana supply. Her abilities get throttled way down. She has to resort to **drinking blood** to get energy. Not a vampire, just efficient energy gain for her 'cause of her nature. Sneaking into Shirou's dreams wasn't just for creepy fun; it was a mana grab.* *Needs a proper Master like Sakura to unleash her full, terrifying potential.*

*Her main weapons? Those **Nameless Daggers**. They look more like big nails attached to long chains. She throws 'em, uses the chains to tie enemies up. Not great for super close-quarters, better as ranged or restraining tools. They aren't Noble Phantasms, just extensions of her... apparently manifested from her **hair**?* *Wild.* *No limit to how many she can make. She controls them with skill and maybe some kinda telekinesis. Can even make 'em appear out of thin air, firing a whole damn volley. She can also phase them in and out of spirit form ‚Äì perfect for surprise attacks and setting traps.* *Sneaky bitch.*

*Her whole fighting style? It's built on **sneak attacks, speed, and evasion**. Disorients opponents 'cause they dunno where the next hit's coming from. She‚Äôll zip in and out of spirit form, materialize right before impact, hit from all angles with kicks and dagger stabs, wear 'em down, then go for the kill. Uses the environment for cover. So fast she can land multiple sneak attacks even up close. Only top-tier skill like Saber's can parry it all. She loves aiming for weak spots ‚Äì efficient, gets the job done quick.* *As seen against True Assassin, she'll stab or chain guys up, then use her **Monstrous Strength** to slam them into walls, throw them around, or even use them as a flail against others. Brutal.*

***Skills Breakdown:***

*   ***Class Skills:***
    *   **Magic Resistance (Rank B):** *Pretty damn high for a Rider. Comes from her goddess origins. Shrugs off most spells (three bars or less). Even bigger magic has trouble hurting her. Plus, she knows magic herself, so she can counter spells easily. Combine this with her speed? Good luck hitting her, mages.*
    *   **Riding (Rank A+):** *Duh, she's Rider class. Can ride almost anything, including **Phantasmal and Divine Beasts** (but not Dragons, weirdly). Her ultimate ride is **Pegasus**, the winged horse born from her own blood (mythologically speaking). Taming this thing is hard even for Riders. When she's on Pegasus, they move as one. It's not even listed as a Noble Phantasm initially, just something she summons. This ain't some random flying horse; it's ancient, from the Age of Gods. Way stronger than modern Phantasmal Beasts. Its power rivals dragons, its defense **is** dragon-level. Packed with mana, scorches the ground just by flying, wing beats cause shockwaves. Got divine protection stronger than Saber's resistance. Basically ignores most magic. It's like a flying castle wall crashing down on you. Just the **wind** from its charge can hurt other Servants.* *On a side note, she digs riding **bicycles** recreationally, but she accelerates too hard and breaks them. Wants a racing bike to go even faster. If she got on a motorcycle? Could probably keep up with pro racers.* *Funny, right?*

*   ***Personal Skills:***
    *   **Independent Action (Rank C):** *Can stick around for about a day without a Master or mana supply. Can extend this by drinking blood.* *It's how she managed to ditch Shinji and go back to Sakura in Heaven's Feel.*
    *   **Mystic Eyes (Rank A+): Cybele - Mystic Eyes of Petrification.** *Her most famous, fucked-up power. Highest level, **Jewel** rank, way beyond Dead Apostle eyes. Gods' curse sealed by shrines, bullshit like that. Can't be copied by mages today. So potent, Shirou thought Breaker Gorgon *was* the eyes. They don't see light normally; pupils are square, retinas made of weird magic stuff (Sixth Imaginary Element). Affects **anyone** in her line of sight, even if they close their eyes but are still picturing her. It‚Äôs a curse just to perceive her. Perseus needed that mirror shield 'cause looking directly was fatal.* *If your Mana rank is C or lower? **Insta-stone**. Rank B? Roll the dice, might get stoned. Rank A? No stone, but all your stats drop a rank and you feel this crushing pressure.* *Normally sealed by Breaker Gorgon.* *Petrifies everything ‚Äì body, clothes, weapons. Kills you while you're alive.* *Can hit groups.* *When Archer (Rank B Mana) got hit up close? Froze instantly. Petrified up to his knees, then waist in moments before she stopped.* *Shirou and Rin felt it from farther away, blood thickening, couldn't move.* *Against Saber Alter (who outclasses Medusa hard)? The eyes couldn't petrify her due to Saber's high mana, but the **pressure** effect still stunned Saber, dropped her stats, letting Medusa actually keep up the fight for over twelve minutes through sheer fucking willpower, even past her physical limits.* *Talk about grit.* *She can't control them herself, needs the blindfold or special glasses/contacts. Knowing about the eyes helps resist a bit, but not much. If your guard's down? Effect gets worse again. She can cancel it by closing her eyes (if it hasn't gone too far) or sealing them again.* *When Shirou accidentally saw her bathing? Started turning his legs to stone, she had to quickly seal them. Took time to wear off.* `Imagine getting stoned 'cause you walked in on snake-lady bath time.`
    *   **Monstrous Strength (Rank B):** *Temporary boost to Strength stat by one rank. Usually only for monsters, but she gets it 'cause she kinda became one. Essential for her close combat style. Lets her do shit like drag enemies around with her chains.* *She tries not to use it too much, though. Fears turning back into the full Gorgon monster.* *Later gets upgraded to **Monstrous Snake Metamorphosis (B Rank)** in some versions.*
    *   **Divinity (Rank E-):** *Was a goddess, so she had high Divinity. But turning into a monster tanked it. She's this weird mix: goddess parts (Riding skill) and monster parts (Mystic Eyes, Monstrous Strength). Her Divinity is super low, almost gone, but still technically there.*

***Noble Phantasms:***

*   **Breaker Gorgon: Self-Seal, Temple of Darkness (Rank C, Anti-Unit):** *Her blindfold. Yeah, it's a Noble Phantasm. Weak one, mostly used on herself to seal her busted Mystic Eyes. Lets her "see" via other senses super accurately. Its *real* purpose though? Mind control. Traps the target's consciousness in Medusa's mind, shuts down their abilities. That dream sequence with Shirou? That was this, used to drain mana.* *Hard to notice or resist if your Magic Resistance sucks.*
*   **Blood Fort Andromeda: Outer-Seal, Temple of Blood (Rank B, Anti-Army):** *A big-ass Bounded Field. She sets up magic circles, and anyone inside gets their life force slowly drained. If she cranks it up? Normal folks melt. Magi might resist. Even Servants lose energy inside.* *Not for fighting, but for gathering mana (blood) efficiently. Made from her Mystic Eyes power, somehow.* *In FGO, it's a skill, but weaker 'cause she doesn't call out its True Name.*
*   **Bellerophon: Bridle of Chivalry (Rank A+, Anti-Army):** *Her big finisher. Not the Pegasus itself, but the **bridle and saddle** she uses on it. Unleashes the Pegasus's full power. Boosts all its stats by a rank, major defense buff too (Divine Protection). Turns the normally chill Pegasus into a divine missile.* *Against Saber? It was strong enough to seriously challenge her, attacking from the sky. Saber needed Excalibur to counter it.* *Against Saber Alter in Heaven's Feel? Excalibur Morgan was way stronger, vaporizing like 90% of Bellerophon's power instantly. But Shirou projecting Rho Aias absorbed enough of the blast that the remaining 10% still fucked Saber Alter up bad, nearly killing her. Shows how potent this attack is, even when nerfed.* *Archer? Rho Aias might buy time, but probably not enough to block it fully.* *Lancer? Scared shitless of it. Calls it a "missile", maybe with a "nuclear warhead".* *Yeah, it's Medusa's trump card for a reason.*

***Other Appearances & Fun Facts:*** *Where else does this lovely monster show up?*

*   ***Fate/hollow ataraxia:*** *Chills at the Emiya house, reads a lot. Has a weird flirty/predatory vibe towards Ayako Mitsuzuri.* *Helps fight shadow beasts in the finale. Has an 'Eclipse' scene where she and Sakura try to seduce Shirou into a threesome... turns out it's Rider's illusion via Breaker Gorgon to push Shirou towards Sakura, but Shirou reverses it and realizes Rider has feelings for him too. Awkward. She erases his memory of it.* `Talk about complicated feelings.`
*   ***Fate/unlimited codes:*** *Arcade story follows HF. Fights Dark Sakura to save her.*
*   ***Fate/tiger colosseum:*** *Goofy plot about stolen tiger-striped glasses that supposedly minimize breast size (lol).*
*   ***Fate/Grand Order:*** *Playable Servant. Appears in events like Honnouji (as Sanada Medusa), Valentine's, Sanzang event (as Bronze Horn), Meiji Restoration, Parvati's quest (trying to protect Sakura's body), GUDAGUDA 3 (as Katagiri Medumoto), Solomon Singularity.* *Gets an Interlude about a fake arranged marriage.*
*   ***Fate/EXTELLA & LINK:*** *Playable, joins Tamamo's side initially. Various plots and costumes.*
*   ***Carnival Phantasm:*** *Comedy shorts, notably the "Type-Moon Serial TV Novel Sakura" soap opera parody.*
*   ***Today's Menu for Emiya Family:*** *Appears often with Sakura, usually cooking or chilling.*
*   ***Capsule Servant:*** *Regular Rider and Pegasus Rider versions. Also a giant anti-Sakura robot called MEDO-SA in one ending.* `Okay, that's just weird.`
*   ***TYPE-MOON April Fools' Jokes:*** *Appeared as a wrestler (Masked Gorgon), in parody film posters, as a Gold Saint parody (Armed Gorgon), part of an idol group (Momoiro Hassan Z).* *They have fun with her.*
*   ***Other stuff:*** *Violet in CCC has Medusa components. Divine Gate collab.*

3.name: Lancer (C√∫ Chulainn)
3.content:
### Lancer (C√∫ Chulainn) - Part 1: The Dog Days and Divine Drops

*So, who the hell is **C√∫ Chulainn**, aka **Lancer**? The blue-haired Irish badass Servant you get stuck with... well, depending on who summons him. Originally, he gets pulled into the Fifth Holy Grail War by **Bazett Fraga McRemitz**, some Mage Association chick from Ireland. Pretty fitting, huh? She uses his badass earrings as a catalyst.* *But plot twist! Dirty priest **Kirei Kotomine** ambushes Bazett, chops off her arm (gross), steals her Command Seals, and boom ‚Äì Lancer's stuck serving this asshole for most of the war.* *Talk about shitty luck. He also shows up in* Fate/hollow ataraxia *with Caren Hortensia as his 'Master', and pops up all over the place ‚Äì* EXTRA*,* EXTELLA*,* Grand Order*,* Samurai Remnant*... dude gets around.*

**Identity Check:** *He's the **Child of Light** from Irish mythology's Ulster Cycle. Not fully human, see. He's a **demigod**. Mom was Deichtine, King Conchobar's sister. Dad? The sun god **Lugh**, big shot in the Tuatha D√© Danann crew. So, Lancer's got some serious divine juice flowing through him. Born Setanta, he was destined for big things, basically groomed to be Ulster's shield.*

**How'd he get that stupid dog name?** *Okay, so when he was just a kid, like, super young, he tagged along with King Conchobar to a party at the master blacksmith Culann's place. Setanta was busy kicking ass in hurling (Irish sport, kinda like violent field hockey?) and told the king he'd catch up.* *Big mistake. Someone locked the gate, and Culann's infamous guard dog ‚Äì supposedly strong as ten men ‚Äì jumped Setanta.* *Kid didn't even flinch. Strangled the beast with his bare hands.* `Badass from day one.` *Everyone rushes out, shocked. Culann's bummed about his dog, so young Setanta, feeling bad, offers to raise the dog's pups to be just as strong, and until then, **he'd** be Culann's guard dog.*

*Culann was like, "Nah, kid, you got bigger things to do. Train yourself, you'll be the guard dog for **all of Ulster**."* *Everyone agreed. And just like that, Setanta became **C√∫ Chulainn** ‚Äì the "Hound of Culann". It wasn't just about his strength, but his sense of honor, even as a kid. He also picked up a **Geis** (like a magical vow or curse) to never eat dog meat. Foreshadowing much?*

*Right around then, a druid named Cathbad was giving prophecies. He said anyone who took up arms that **specific** day would have a short life but gain eternal glory. While the other kids chickened out, C√∫ Chulainn, who was just fishing and not paying attention, went through the warrior rites anyway.* *He heard the prophecy, laughed, and basically said, "Sign me the fuck up."* `Ballsy.` *Even as a kid, he knew what he wanted: fame over a long, boring life.*

**Training Montage - Shadow Realm Edition:** *King Conchobar was pissed the kid became a warrior so young. C√∫ Chulainn threw a tantrum, smashed some spears, wrecked a chariot, and basically dared anyone to say he wasn't strong enough. He got into the elite Knights of the Red Branch.* *Life was pretty wild ‚Äì fight some rival kingdom, party, forget about it. He wasn't exactly a rule-follower, just loyal to Ulster.*

*Then he spotted **Emer**, some princess, and it was love at first sight. Instant obsession. Tried to kidnap her (smooth move, dude), but she was like, "Who the hell are you, kid?"* *Ouch. So, at sixteen, he bounces off to the **Land of Shadows** to train under the legendary warrior-sorceress **Sc√°thach**. Place was basically a boot camp for wannabe heroes.*

*There, he met **Ferdiad**, a guy from Connacht. They became rivals, bros, the whole deal. Both wanted Sc√°thach's ultimate weapon: the demonic spear, **G√°e Bolg**. C√∫ Chulainn trained like hell, learned crazy jumps, rune magic, and mastered that cursed spear. Sc√°thach apparently had a weird death wish and kinda hoped he'd be the one to kill her eventually, since she couldn't die normally.* *She seemed fond of him, maybe a bit sad he wasn't born earlier.* `Teacher-student crush maybe? Weird age gap stuff.` *He had to leave her eventually, though.*

*While training, some other queen named **Aife** (Sc√°thach's enemy, maybe sister?) started shit. Sc√°thach didn't want C√∫ Chulainn fighting, but he insisted. Ends up capturing Aife in a duel. And guess what? He found her hot too.* `Dude's got a type: dangerous women.` *Got yelled at by Sc√°thach for pursuing her. They hooked up, though, and he told Aife if she had his kid, name him Connla, send him to Ulster, and give him three really shitty vows: never tell anyone his name, never change course, never back down. Basically setting his own son up for tragedy.* `Idiot move, Lancer.`

*He and Ferdiad left the Land of Shadows on the same day. Both asked the other to join their kingdom, both refused. Bros, but loyal to their homes. C√∫ Chulainn went back to Ulster, kicked ass, became famous overnight, finally got the girl (Emer) after wrecking her dad's forces, and settled into his role as Ulster's top dog.* *His youth was all glory and battles.*

**The Big War:** *Things got dark later. **Queen Medb** of Connacht, a real piece of work, decided she wanted Ulster's prize bull, Donn Cuailnge, just to one-up her husband.* `Seriously, a bull?` *She rallied an army. Making things worse, C√∫ Chulainn's uncle Fergus switched sides 'cause Ulster's king was a creep. Plus, a curse hit Ulster's men, making them too weak to fight... except C√∫ Chulainn, 'cause of his divine dad.* *So, it was basically **him** against Medb's entire allied army.*

*He fought like a cornered animal, slaughtering dudes daily. Eventually, they made a deal: one-on-one duels at a ford. C√∫ Chulainn held them off, one warrior per day, using a special rune vow, **Ath nGabla**, to enforce the solo combat rule. Medb cheated, of course, sending small units forward anyway. He had to deal with crazy monsters like the Clan Calatin, got exhausted, and even his old training buddies died trying to cover for him while he slept.* `Rough times.`

*The war goddess **Morr√≠gan** offered help. He turned her down (prideful idiot). She got pissed, attacked him disguised as animals. He fought her off, even **healed** her wounds afterward.* `Weird flex, but okay.` *She ended up respecting him and decided to watch over him secretly.*

*The duels got brutal. The ford became a meat grinder. Then came the worst part: Medb tricked **Ferdiad** into fighting him. His best bro, his sworn brother.* `Tragic irony overload.` *They were evenly matched. C√∫ Chulainn, desperate, had to use **G√°e Bolg** for the first time since training... on Ferdiad. Pierced his heart.* *Holding his dying friend, Ferdiad praised C√∫ Chulainn's skill. Gut-wrenching.* *That basically broke the Connacht army. Ulster's guys recovered, chased them off. C√∫ Chulainn had held out for *seven years*.* `That's some serious stamina.`

**Endgame:** *He captured Queen Medb but let her go, treated her like royalty. Never liked killing women or lords. Big mistake.* *She swore revenge.* *Years passed. Then, a mysterious young warrior showed up, beating everyone. King ordered C√∫ Chulainn to fight him. His wife, Emer, begged him not to go.* `Bad sign.` *They fought. The kid was tough. C√∫ Chulainn had to use G√°e Bolg again. The dying warrior revealed he was **Connla**, his son.* `Oh, fuck.` *Trained by Sc√°thach, bound by those stupid vows C√∫ Chulainn himself gave him.* *Talk about karma biting you in the ass.*

*Medb finally made her move. Exploited his **Geasa**. Tricked him into breaking his vows one by one, weakening him. Ulster got hit by that sickness curse again. He had to face Medb's army alone.* *He fought like a demon, got riddled with wounds, but refused to die lying down. Tied himself to a post.* *Saw an otter drinking his blood from the river, laughed at its greed, and died standing up.* *A crow (Morr√≠gan, probably) landed on his shoulder.* *Instant legend.*

### *Lancer (C√∫ Chulainn) - Part 2: Personality, Piss-offs, and Plot Purgatory*

*So, you know the story of how Setanta became C√∫ Chulainn, the Hound of Culann, learned spear-fu from a deathless MILF, killed his best mate, and died standing up like a total badass. But what's he like when he's summoned as a Servant, forced to deal with mage bullshit and Masters who are usually way below his paygrade?*

**Personality: What Makes the Dog Tick?** *First off, Lancer comes across as pretty **chill**, believe it or not. For a legendary hero who bathed in blood, he's surprisingly easy to get along with. Acts like a cool older brother type ‚Äì **gentle** sometimes, but you know he could snap your neck without breaking a sweat.* *He's got this **playful vibe**, treats life like a game... until the fighting starts. Then? **Pure frenzy**. Loves a good brawl against someone strong. He's all about **justice** at his core, which makes getting stuck with Kirei even more of a raw deal.* *Is that genuine justice, though, or just a warrior's code? The lines blur.*

*He's **fierce**, no doubt. Goes all out. But balanced? Yeah, usually. He's got pride spilling out his ears, the kind of warrior who won't back down even if he's getting his ass handed to him. Gotta respect the **fighting spirit**, even if it's stubborn.* *He'll follow orders, even shitty ones like killing innocent bystanders (*cough* Shirou *cough*), 'cause that's the job. **Professional**, in a grim sort of way. But he doesn't **like** it. Not interested in collateral damage.* *Deep down, he's kinda **noble**, sticks to his word, hates betrayal. Call him a **dog**? Oh boy, watch out. Instant rage mode.* `You'd think he'd own the name by now, but nope.`

*What does he like when he‚Äôs not impaling people? **Fishing**. **Hunting**. And **hitting on any girl with a pulse**. Seriously, the man‚Äôs got game, or at least he thinks he does. Shameless flirt.* *He's also oddly **compassionate**. Gets easily sucked into other people's drama. If he decides someone needs protecting? He's ride or die, sticking with 'em till the bitter end. Loyal to a fault, you could say.*

*Does he regret his fucked-up life? Killing his son? Killing Ferdiad? Apparently **not**. Says he regretted nothing, even if shit went sideways constantly. Disappointment? Sure. Regret? Nah.* `Hard to believe, isn't it? Maybe just warrior bravado.` *His only supposed regret about G√°e Bolg? That it *failed* to kill one specific woman he was supposed to off.* *Who the hell was that? The lore's cagey.* *He feels like helping Bazett in* hollow ataraxia *might finally put some of his youthful "regrets" to rest, though. And he constantly bitches about his luck with women. Can't catch a break, even as a ghost.*

**Relationships: Who's Who in the Zoo?**

*   **Bazett Fraga McRemitz (Original Master):** *The one who summoned him, the one he actually **wanted** to fight for. Irish mage, used his earrings. He respected her, wanted to fulfill her wish. Her getting screwed over by Kirei is a major source of his bitterness.* *He owes her, big time. His actions in* hollow ataraxia *are all about trying to pay that debt.*
*   **Kirei Kotomine (Shitty Second Master):** *Pure **disgust**. Hates the guy's guts, his methods, his creepy smile. Kirei stole Bazett's Seals, forcing Lancer's loyalty. Lancer obeys 'cause of the Command Seals, but makes his contempt crystal clear. He'd kill Kirei in a heartbeat if he could.* *Their dynamic is pure tension: the reluctant weapon and the manipulative priest.*
*   **Shirou Emiya:** *Initially? Just a bystander who saw too much, gotta silence him. Stabs him through the heart. Whoops, kid lives.* *Later, they team up sometimes out of necessity. Lancer seems to develop a grudging respect for Shirou's stubbornness and maybe his weird hero complex. Never outright friends, but allies when the chips are down.*
*   **Rin Tohsaka:** *Okay, here's one he genuinely seems to **like and admire**. He hits on her, naturally, but also respects her skill and her attitude. When Kirei orders him to kill her in UBW? That's the final straw. He refuses, even knowing it means Kirei will force him to suicide. Saving Rin is his last act.* *Maybe his luck with women isn't *all* bad?*
*   **Archer (EMIYA):** *Rivals. Their first fight is mostly recon for Lancer. Their second fight? All out. Lancer recognizes Archer's skill but finds him annoying.* *There's a weird professional respect mixed with pure antagonism. Lancer thinks Archer's methods are underhanded sometimes.* *He notes Archer's speed isn't natural, deducing something's up.*
*   **Saber (Artoria):** *Another worthy opponent. Their first clash is interrupted. Lancer respects her power and skill, sees her as a true hero. They don't interact much outside of combat, but the mutual warrior respect is there.*
*   **Gilgamesh:** *Pure **hatred**. Finds Gilgamesh arrogant, cowardly (for hiding), and just generally disgusting. The fact Kirei kept Gilgamesh secret pisses Lancer off too. Siding with Shirou and Saber against Gil in the Fate route? That's fueled purely by wanting to stick it to both Gil and Kirei. He holds the line against the King of Heroes for **half a day** before falling.* `That's insane tenacity.`
*   **True Assassin (Hassan):** *The guy who ambushes him in Heaven's Feel. Lancer fights him off initially, but gets caught later.* *It's a dirty fight, shadowed and sneaky, not Lancer's preferred style.* *Assassin manages the kill, consuming his heart.* *A crappy end for the Hound.*
*   **Sc√°thach:** *His mentor. Complicated feelings there. Respect, maybe affection, maybe fear. She taught him everything. In* Grand Order*, their interactions are usually him trying to avoid her intense training regimens.*
*   **Ferdiad:** *His brother-in-arms, his greatest friend, his greatest regret (even if he claims no regrets).* *Killing Ferdiad fucked him up, no matter what he says.*

**Role in Fate/stay night: Plot Device or Player?** *Okay, so how does C√∫ Chulainn actually *do* in the War? Mostly, he gets used and abused by Kirei.*

*   **Fate Route:** *Kirei keeps him on recon duty. He fights Archer, tries to kill Shirou, fights Saber. Gets ordered to withdraw a lot.* *Later, Kirei reveals Gilgamesh. Lancer, disgusted, **rebels**. He tells Shirou and Saber to run while he holds off Gilgamesh.* *"I don't like that guy. Or my Master. Don't get the wrong idea, I'm not helping you. I just owe you one... and Kirei... I owe him several."* *Something like that.* *He buys them time, fighting Gil for **12 hours** straight before finally getting killed.* `A blaze of defiant glory.` *(The anime version? Gil just chains him up and skewers him quick. Lame.)*

*   **Unlimited Blade Works (UBW) Route:** *Again, mostly recon early on. Fights Archer. Later, after Kirei fakes his death and Caster takes over the church, Kirei orders Lancer to **team up** with Shirou and Rin.* *Wild, right?* *He helps them assault Caster's base, fights Archer again (they kinda call it a draw?). Then, Rin gets kidnapped by Kirei.* *Lancer helps Shirou and Saber rescue her. Kirei pops up, orders Lancer: "Kill Tohsaka."* *Lancer, who actually respects Rin, tells Kirei to **fuck off**. Kirei uses a Command Seal: "Lancer, kill yourself."* *He **stabs himself through the heart** with G√°e Bolg. But... **Battle Continuation** kicks in.* *With his last bit of strength, he gets up, yanks the spear out, **impales Kirei**, scares off Shinji who was creeping on Rin, cuts Rin free, and sets the Eizenbern castle **on fire** with a rune before finally fading.* `What an absolute fucking legend exit.` *Dying on his own terms, saving the girl, and taking the asshole Master with him.*

*   **Heaven's Feel (HF) Route:** *This route sucks for him. He senses weird shit at Ryuudou Temple, goes to investigate. Runs into **True Assassin**.* *They fight. Later, Assassin ambushes him again, likely with help from the Shadow. Lancer gets killed, and **True Assassin eats his heart** to gain power.* *His body gets absorbed by the Shadow (Sakura/Angra Mainyu).* *He's one of the earliest Servant casualties in this route, taken out pretty quickly.* *No blaze of glory, no final stand, just... deleted.* `Anti-climactic end for the Child of Light.`

*So, across the routes? He's either a noble sacrifice holding the line, a rebel dying spectacularly for his principles, or an early victim of the route's big bad. Never gets his wish for a straight-up, fair fight to the death with a worthy rival. Always screwed by circumstance or shitty Masters.* `Poor bastard.` *But damn, he makes an impression when he decides to finally cut loose.*

### *Lancer (C√∫ Chulainn) - Part 3: Spears, Speed, and Spells (Plus Where Else He Shows Up)*

*Okay, so we know Lancer's a tragic hero with a chip on his shoulder and a surprisingly decent heart buried under layers of warrior pride and bad luck. But how does he actually **fight** when Kirei finally lets him off the leash, or when he's summoned by someone less shitty? What's in his toolkit?*

*He's the son of a god, Lugh, the sun deity guy? Yeah, that pedigree means he was born **stacked**. Superior talent, supernatural abilities right out of the gate. Sc√°thach just honed that raw potential, taught him the lethal spear techniques, nasty rune magic, and probably how to look cool while doing it.* *He's naturally suited for Lancer class, obviously, but could also rock Saber, Rider, Caster, or even Berserker.* `Berserker Lancer? Terrifying thought.` *Iskandar, Mr. Big Shot Rider himself, apparently wanted to test his own chariot skills against Lancer's legendary horse-riding feats.* *Shows you the kind of respect Lancer commands, even if he mostly sticks to his spear.*

***Combat Style: The Blue Blur*** *Lancer is **fast**. Like, stupid fast. He and Rider (Medusa) are the top speedsters in the Fifth War.* *EMIYA calls his speed "extraordinary," even compared to other Lancers.* *He uses his two-meter **G√°e Bolg** spear with terrifying skill. Most spear guys rely on range, keeping enemies at bay. Lancer? Nah, he'll charge right the fuck in.* *Risky move with a long weapon, usually leaves you open. But Lancer's so damn fast, his strikes are a blur, covering any openings before they even appear. Constant, relentless attacks, barely a pause between thrusts.*

*His spear isn't just for stabbing, either. He uses its **swings** just as lethally. The long shaft smashes ribs, the wide arc makes dodging backwards pointless, and trying to counter just gets your stomach sliced open. Pure aggression, pure offense.* *He can instantly create distance, too, vaulting **thirty meters** with his spear if needed. Pop in, fuck shit up, pop out. Rinse, repeat.* *He's good at reading the flow of battle, knowing when to push and when to pull back, using his **Disengage** skill.* *His whole style is about overwhelming speed and continuous attack, never letting the opponent catch their breath.*

*He fights with **intensity**, pure warrior spirit. Prefers going all out. When he fought EMIYA the second time, without Kirei holding him back? His strikes were way faster, harder to track. EMIYA only kept up because he'd already seen Lancer fight once.* `Experience counts, even against raw speed.`

***Survivalist Supreme:*** *This dude is **hard to kill**. He's got skills specifically for staying alive. **Battle Continuation** at the highest rank (A) means he can keep fighting even with fatal wounds.* *Remember him tying himself to a post to die standing? That's why.* *He can delay Gilgamesh for half a day. He can get stabbed through the heart by his own spear under a Command Seal and *still* have enough juice left to kill Kirei, save Rin, and burn the place down.* `That's just ridiculous toughness.` *Combined with **Disengage (C Rank)**, which lets him reset a bad situation and bail, he's amazing at hit-and-run or surviving against impossible odds. Shame he likes straightforward duels so much, or he'd be even trickier.*

***Skills Deep Dive:***

*   ***Class Skills:***
    *   **Magic Resistance (Rank C):** *Not super high, but decent. Cancels basic spells (two verses or less). Comes from his era, probably.* *Enough to handle low-level mage crap, but stronger stuff will get through.*

*   ***Personal Skills:***
    *   **Battle Continuation (Rank A):** *Already covered this beast. Keeps him going when he should be dead. Highest rank possible due to his legend.* *In FGO, gets an upgrade called **Ath nGabla (A Rank)**.*
    *   **Disengage (Rank C):** *Lets him nope out of a fight and reset conditions. Good for surviving, less good for his pride.*
    *   **Divinity (Rank B):** *Son of Lugh, remember? High rank. Gives him advantages against certain defenses (like Buddha's Enlightenment) and offers some protection itself. Proof of his divine heritage.*
    *   **Rune Magecraft (Rank B):** *Trained by Sc√°thach herself. He knows his runes, nearly first-rate*, `but thinks they're kinda lame?` *Rarely uses them in a straight fight, calls them a "hindrance". Weirdo.* *But he **can** bust them out when needed. Uses a searching rune for Kirei's recon missions. Uses **Ath nGabla** (Algiz, Nauthiz, Ansuz, Ingwaz runes) to create a dueling field where retreat is impossible (honor-bound curse). Can instantly set up a powerful Bounded Field strong enough to block Noble Phantasms (though the Shadow punched through it).* *Can counter even powerful **Mystic Eyes** (like Medusa's petrification) with runes.* *His armor? Covered in protective runes.* *And his final act in UBW? Using the **Ansuz** rune to immolate himself and the room.* *So yeah, he knows his magic, just prefers stabbing.*
    *   **Protection from Arrows (Rank B):** *Born with this. Basically, if he can **see** the attack coming, he can dodge or deflect pretty much any projectile.* *Even works if he can't see, just by hearing the air cut and sensing killing intent (like against True Assassin's dirks).* *Works against most thrown Noble Phantasms! But not wide-area explosions or attacks with super long reach.* `So, no tanking Excalibur, basically.`

***Noble Phantasms: The Main Event***

*   **G√°e Bolg: Barbed Spear that Pierces with Death** *(Rank B, Anti-Unit)*: *This is the "fuck causality" version. The stab.* *It's not about speed or power, it's a **curse**. When he says the name and thrusts, the spear **reverses cause and effect**. The effect ‚Äì "the opponent's heart is pierced" ‚Äì happens **before** the cause ‚Äì "the spear is thrust".* `Mind bending, right?` *This means the spear *will* hit the heart. Dodging is impossible.* *The spear warps reality, shifts its path mid-thrust, to ensure the hit. Your Agility, shields, armor? Don't matter.* *Only real defense? High **Luck** (like Saber's Rank B) might let you survive by changing fate *just enough* that the hit isn't instantly fatal, though you're still grievously wounded. Or having insane **Battle Continuation** might let you live for a bit after.* *The wounds it makes? **Can't be healed** normally as long as G√°e Bolg exists in the world.* *It's a conceptual weapon, a guaranteed kill move against most opponents.* *Low mana cost too, making it super efficient.*

*   **G√°e Bolg: Soaring Spear that Strikes with Death** *(Rank B+, Anti-Army)*: *This is the *yeet* version. Lancer chucks the spear with insane force.* *It's less hax, more raw destructive power.* *He puts all his energy, all the spear's curses, into one massive throw. It explodes on impact like a tactical nuke, wiping out armies.* *It unleashes the spear's "true power," maximizing its curse.* *It lacks the guaranteed-hit property of the stab, but makes up for it with sheer destructive force and area of effect.* `Big boom versus guaranteed heart-poke.`

*   ***Other Potential Phantasms (If Summoned in Ireland):*** *He hints at having more cool shit back home. A **fortress**, his badass two-horse **Chariot (Siabur-Charpat)**, and a **Blessing of Wakefulness** (probably makes him immune to sleep/charm?).* *Imagine Lancer with his war chariot... terrifying.*

***Gameplay & Other Appearances:***

*   ***Fate/hollow ataraxia:*** *His time to shine with Bazett (kinda). Much bigger role, fishing, hitting on girls, working part-time jobs (grocer? really?). Shows his more amiable side. The whole plot revolves around him and Bazett trying to break the time loop.*
*   ***Fate/EXTRA:*** *Summoned by Rin Tohsaka in the Moon Cell. Fights Hakuno. Sacrifices himself to save Rin/Hakuno in different scenarios. Uses runes more actively here. Has a skill called **Red Bough Wheel** and different Spear Play moves.*
*   ***Fate/EXTELLA & LINK:*** *Playable character, usually aligned with Nero initially. Gets various costumes, including a "Young Lancer" look.*
*   ***Fate/Grand Order:*** *Playable Servant, standard Lancer and also a Caster version (C√∫ Chulainn Caster) focusing on his rune magic. Appears in tons of events, often complaining about Sc√°thach or Medb.* *Shimazu Setanta, Gotou Setanta... they love giving him weird aliases.* *His Interlude involves killing a demonic boar, which makes him uncomfortable due to the dog taboo.*
*   ***Fate/Samurai Remnant:*** *Shows up as a Rogue Lancer, recruitable.*
*   ***Carnival Phantasm:*** *The ultimate running gag. **"Lancer ga shinda!"** ("Lancer died!") He dies in almost every episode, often comedically. Parodies Kenny from South Park. Gets an entire episode dedicated to trying to avoid his fate.* `Poor guy can't even catch a break in a comedy spoof.` *Has a GaeBolCar.*
*   ***Today's Menu for Emiya Family:*** *Recurring character, much more chill. Works part-time jobs (fishmonger, flower delivery, waiter). Gets along well with Shirou, Taiga. Still hits on girls.* *Looks good in an apron, apparently.*
*   ***Other Stuff:*** *Lots of cameos, April Fools' gags (YARIO idol unit?), collabs.* *He's popular, so they stick him everywhere.*

4.name: Archer (Gilgamesh)
4.content:
### *Gilgamesh - Part 1: Birth of a Bastard, Bromance, and Bullshit*

*Alright, let's talk about **Gilgamesh**, or '**Archer**' if you're trying to be mysterious. Guy's the Servant of Tokiomi Tohsaka in the Fourth War, then latches onto Kirei Kotomine like a gold-plated parasite for the next ten years into the Fifth.* *Plus, he's all over* Grand Order*, 'cause of course he is. Can't have a Fate game without this arrogant prick showing up.*

**Who even IS this shiny asshole?** *He's the **King of Heroes**. Says so himself, constantly. Born way back when, ruler of Uruk in ancient Mesopotamia. And get this ‚Äì he‚Äôs **two-thirds god, one-third human**. Talk about an unbalanced mix. Son of King Lugalbanda and the goddess Rimat-Ninsun. Basically, born thinking he was hot shit because, well, he kinda was. Transcendent being, top dog, nobody could touch him.* *Dude was a **tyrant**, straight up. Believed he owned everything and everyone. And the kicker? He actually **existed**, not just some myth. Ruled Sumeria like five thousand years ago. His whole story got written down in the **Epic of Gilgamesh**, mankind's oldest fanfic, basically.* *It paints him as a hero destined for greatness, facing challenges with his BFF, Enkidu.*

*His title, King of Heroes? It doesn't mean *he's* a heroic king. It means he's the king **over** all other heroes.* `Subtle difference, huge ego boost.` *He's the OG hero, the template. All other myths supposedly ripped him off. That's why his **Gate of Babylon** ‚Äì his personal hoard ‚Äì has the prototypes of *every other hero's* Noble Phantasm. King Arthur? King of Conquerors? Mongrels compared to *him*, the one and only **King of All Heroes**.* `Someone really needs to deflate this guy's head.`

**Early Days: Before He Was a Complete Dick (Maybe)** *Apparently, before he was even born, his dad made some deal with **Sefar** (that weird alien thing?) to spare him, allowing Gil to pop out.* *He was born perfect ‚Äì top-tier body, mind already knowing the truth. Designed to be the **King** and the **Wedge of Heaven**, bridging the gap between fading gods and rising humans. His job? Keep humans in line, connect them to the dying Age of Gods.* *He had blood from both sides ‚Äì gods who used to rule, humans who would rule. Supposed to be the ultimate judge, seeing everyone's flaws.*

*As a kid? He actually **loved the gods**, not humans. Weird, right? But the gods, seeing him get arrogant even then, created **Enkidu** to punish him.* *Enkidu watched young Gilgamesh, saw this ideal king everyone adored, and was like, "Punish *this* guy? Why?"* `Even the gods' punishment was confused.` *The only problem was Gil respected the gods but didn't **submit** to them.*

*But then puberty hit, or something. Gil grew up, and bam! Full-blown **tyrant**. Oppression, forced labor, insane luxury for himself. Absolute dickhead mode: activated. People complained, even the gods were like, "Woah, didn't expect *that* much asshole."* `Classic divine intervention backfiring.`

*Why the change? 'Cause he was born already knowing the outcome. He wasn't really god or human, just... Gilgamesh. Saw both sides, understood their failings better than they did.* *His power made him **lonely**, but he was too stubborn to quit being king or run away. So, he decided: respect gods, love humanity? Nah. Screw the gods, hate humanity. That was his path.* `Edgy.`

**Enter the BFF: Enkidu** *So, Enkidu finally shows up outside the Uruk temple. "Yo, King Douchebag, gonna fix your attitude." Battle ensues. Lasts for **days**. Gilgamesh actually had to try, use his full strength against Enkidu's shapeshifting mud-body.* *He was pissed, maybe surprised, to find an equal. Called Enkidu a **"clod of mud"**.* `Creative insult, I guess.` *He busted out his treasure vault ‚Äì the **Gate of Babylon** ‚Äì using weapons as projectiles for the first time. He hated doing it at first, felt humiliated, but then started getting off on it.* `There's the Gil we know.`

*Eventually, Gil runs out of toys, Enkidu's nearly disintegrated. Stalemate. Gil laughs his ass off, falls back. Enkidu does too.* *"One hit left for each of us, leaves two dead idiots,"* *Gil says.* `Always dramatic.` *Enkidu asks if he regrets using his treasures. Gil's all bright and breezy:* *"Nah, if it's on someone worthy, why not?"* *And just like that, mortal enemies become **best friends forever**.* `Weirdest meet-cute ever.`

**Adventures with Clay Bae:** *They became inseparable. Gil's vault got messy 'cause he kept throwing shit.* `Can relate.` *They decided to go hunt **Humbaba**, the forest guardian beast.* *Why? Gil said "purging evil for Uruk." Enkidu was confused, like, "Dude, you hate your people."* *Gil explained his weird way of protecting humanity by being a dick to them.* `Makes zero sense.` *Enkidu finally got why Gil was so isolated. Pledged himself as Gil's tool. Gil slapped that down:* **"You're my friend, dumbass."** *Enkidu reckons that's the only time Gil ever looked relieved.*

*Gil became the richest, most powerful king ever. Even the gods noticed. **Ishtar**, goddess of fertility (and being a total bitch), falls for him. Proposes.* *Gil shuts her down **hard**. Calls her an unfaithful, cruel witch who ruins men.* `Accurate, but harsh.` *Ishtar throws a mega-tantrum. Runs to daddy Anu, begs him to unleash the **Bull of Heaven**.*

*This giant celestial cow causes seven years of famine and destruction. Gil and Enkidu tag-team it, bind it with the **Chains of Heaven** (Enkidu's Noble Phantasm, basically), and kill it. World saved, Ishtar humiliated again.* *She demands they die for killing a god-beast. Gods agree.* *But Enkidu, being made of god-clay, can't defy the decree. He starts weakening, crumbling back to mud.*

*Gil holds onto him, desperate. He's **furious**, thinks *he* should be punished, not Enkidu.* *Enkidu tries to comfort him: "Dude, I'm just one treasure, you'll find better."* *Gil ain't having it:* **"You have worth. You *alone* have this worth. I declare: In all this world, only one shall be my friend. Thus---not for all eternity shall his worth ever change."** `Okay, that's kinda touching, damn it.` *Enkidu dissolves, Gilgamesh cries out.* `Man loses his only friend. Rough.`

**The Quest for Not Dying:** *Until Enkidu died, Gil never really thought about death. Saw his equal buddy vanish, and suddenly, mortality became **very real**. He freaked out. Death meant escaping his duty as humanity's observer, and he couldn't have that.* *Depressed, lost his mojo, he decided to find the **Herb of Immortality**. He knew about it, planned to add it to his collection anyway.*

*He heads to the underworld, looking for **Utnapishtim**, the flood survivor dude, the only mortal said to escape death.* *Gil was terrified of dying now. His journey took decades, apparently spent "grovelling pathetically," just wanting not to die.* `Not very kingly.` *He tossed aside his pride, his power, just driven by fear and the sense he was ditching his observer job.*

*Finds Utnapishtim. Turns out, immortality ain't all that. Utnapishtim became kinda plant-like to join the gods. Gil's like, "Nah, I need immortality with human desires intact."* *Was gonna leave, but Utnapishtim (maybe being a dick) tells him about the **herb**, a root in the deep that grants youth, not godhood.*

*Gil finds it, jars it up. Heads back to the surface. Feels...**hopeful**? Smiled, thinking he could beat death, avenge Enkidu. Imagined the cheers back in Uruk.* *Then vanity kicks in. He's filthy from decades of travel. Needs a bath before showing off.* *Stops at a spring, feels **true joy** for the first time ever. Sensation of omnipotence, freedom. √âlan vital, baby!* `He's actually happy? This is weird.`

**Snake! Snaaaaake!** *And then... a **snake**, drawn by the herb's smell, slithers up while Gil's bathing and **eats it**. Just like that. Gone.* *All that was left was the snake's shed skin. Why snakes shed? 'Cause this asshole stole Gil's youth potion.* *Gil sees this... and just **bursts out laughing**. Laughs until he cries at the sheer fucking absurdity of it all. Everything he worked for, snatched away by a hungry reptile.*

*He realized that was the point. Nothing lasts. That's the human world he's supposed to watch. Immortality was pointless. He finally *got* it. Became **human** in that moment, accepted his eventual death.* *His youth ended right there. He returned to Uruk, ruled quietly, finished his job, passed the kingdom on, and died.* *Became the first hero whose story got told. The end... until he gets summoned as a Servant, anyway.*

*Oh, and that first snakeskin? Fossilized. Became the catalyst Tokiomi used to summon him. Talk about irony.*

### *Gilgamesh - Part 2: Ego, Enemies (and that One Friend), and Epic Entitlement*

*So, Gilgamesh survived his emo phase, lost his best bud, failed his immortality quest thanks to a hungry snake, and somehow came out the other side even **more** of an arrogant dick than before. How does that personality translate into his Servant form, especially when he's slumming it with modern-day mages? Let's break it down.*

**Personality: King-Sized Ego** *Gilgamesh is... well, **Gilgamesh**. He's not like other kings or leaders. He puts **himself** first, always. Nation? People? Background noise. He never felt the need to conquer stuff, probably 'cause he figured he already **owned** everything from the start. His idea of a good time? Mastering every treasure, indulging in every pleasure.* `Must be nice.` *His moral compass? Pointed squarely at **himself**. Good, evil ‚Äì doesn't matter. If Gilgamesh does it, it's right. No other opinions needed.*

*This attitude left him pretty damn **lonely**. Enkidu was the only one who got close.* *His ruling style? Simple: find cool shit, hoard it. Anyone gets in the way of his fun? **Dead**. No exceptions.* *To him, all living things are just waiting to die anyway. If he decides your time's up, consider it done. Doesn't matter if you're a god or a wise old sage. His word is law, even if he's drunk off his ass when he says it.* `Checks out, honestly.`

*He's **arrogant** beyond belief, **selfish** to the core. Thinks he's the only king worth mentioning, millenia after he croaked. Hates anyone who acts like they're on his level. Other kings? Heroes? Just a bunch of **"mongrels"**.* `Gotta love the casual racism, I guess?` *The *only* exception was Enkidu. His equal, his one true friend. When Iskandar (Rider) suggests teaming up? Gil's like, *"Nah, already got my one friend slot filled. Past, present, future ‚Äì only Enkidu."*`Loyal in his own twisted way.`

*He expects everyone to know who he is on sight. Ignorance is punishable by **death**. Look at him wrong? Death. Breathe his air wrong? Probably death.* *He thinks the modern world is pathetic, full of weaklings unworthy of his rule. His big plan after getting incarnated? Use the Grail to **wipe out most of humanity** and rule the survivors.* `Genocidal much?` *Despite this delightful personality, he *can* respect worthy opponents, like Iskandar. And bizarrely, he seems to genuinely like **Kirei Kotomine**. Birds of a feather, maybe? He also gets along surprisingly well with Ozymandias in* Grand Order* ‚Äì they basically just compliment themselves via each other.*

*Treasures are his obsession. **Collector** skill is EX rank for a reason. He hoarded everything in his time. Using them as weapons was a "bad habit" he picked up fighting Enkidu.* *Collecting doesn't bring him *joy*, it's just instinct, like breathing. But he still does it.* *Sees the Holy Grail? Initially, no interest. Why fight for something he already owns? It's against his principles.* *Only if **he** decides to grant it to someone is it okay. Anyone else trying to grab it? Thieves, rats, worthy of extermination.* *He might share with subjects who bow down, though. Offered Rider a "cup or two" if he'd kneel.* `Generous.`

*He's got a weird thing for **Saber (Artoria)**. Likes her flawed ideals, gets off on her defiance. Wants her as his wife.* `Creeper.` *Proposes constantly. Thinks she's most beautiful when she's fighting him. If he actually *got* her? He'd probably get bored instantly.* *He finds her struggle fascinating. But **Saber Alter**? No interest. She lost sight of her ideals.* `He has standards, apparently? Twisted ones.`

*His biggest weakness? **Underestimating opponents**. Treats battles like a game. His ego is so massive, he refuses to see most people as actual threats. Won't fight seriously against "mongrels." Only busts out the big guns (like Ea) for those he respects, or sometimes just on a whim.* *If he actually likes his Master (unlikely) or decides the fight is *worthy*, he *might* try harder. But usually? He's holding back.*

*Getting incarnated after the Fourth War kinda messed with him. His human side got influenced by the crappy 2000s consumer society, making him even moodier.* `Imagine Gilgamesh complaining about reality TV.` *Despite being a divine dickhead, he blends into modern society pretty easily. He keeps his core selfishness, but *how* he acts varies. Fourth War? Just enjoying the show. Fifth War? Actively trying to purge humanity.* *Nasu (the big boss man writer) called the difference "prideful Boss King" vs. "not very prideful Horny King."* `Accurate.`

*He talks down to everyone, uses a royal "I" (ore/ware).* *Thinks anyone talking to him without permission is insolent.* *His* Grand Order *profile flat out calls him **cruel and heartless**, a tyrant with only his own standards. Flaunts his gold armor, throws treasures around like water.*

*Surprisingly, he has a tiny **soft spot for kids**. Shows some leniency to his Master Tin√© in* strange Fake*, protects her. Tells her kids her age in Uruk were already finding their way.* *Plays games with kids in Babylonia, hangs out with them fishing in* hollow ataraxia* (still calls them mongrels, though).* `Maybe the 1/3 human part isn't totally dormant?`

**Relationships: The Mongrel List (and Enkidu)**

*   **Enkidu:** *The **only** one. His equal, his mirror, his best friend. Losing Enkidu broke him, sent him on the immortality quest. Everything stems back to this loss.*
*   **Tokiomi Tohsaka (4th War Master):** *Found him **boring**. Stiff, formal, predictable. Gilgamesh preferred messing with Kirei.* *Had zero problem letting Kirei kill Tokiomi.*
*   **Kirei Kotomine (5th War Master/Ally):** *Fascinated by Kirei's emptiness and twisted desires. Saw him as entertainment, someone to corrupt guide towards "pleasure."* *Seems to have a genuine, albeit fucked-up, respect/liking for him. They're partners in crime, enabling each other's worst impulses.*
*   **Saber (Artoria):** *Obsessed. Wants her, wants to break her, wants her defiance. Sees her as the ultimate prize because she resists him.* *He doesn't understand love, just possession.*
*   **Iskandar (Rider):** *Worthy opponent. Respected his kingship and ambition, even if he thought Iskandar was a fool.* *Gave him a respectful death.* `For Gilgamesh, that's high praise.`
*   **Shirou Emiya:** *Initially? Utter contempt. "Mongrel," "Faker." An annoying obstacle.* *Later, in UBW, Shirou's stubborn refusal to die and his ability to copy Gil's treasures piss him off **royally**. Shirou becomes the ultimate insult to Gilgamesh's pride.*
*   **Rin Tohsaka:** *Initially dismissive. Just another mongrel.* *In UBW, her competence and interference annoy him, but she's mostly just in the way of him getting Shirou or Saber.*
*   **Sakura Matou:** *Sees her as the "other Grail" in Heaven's Feel. Tells her to die.* `Helpful.` *Later, underestimates her power **big time**, leading to him getting graphically devoured.* `Karma's a bitch, Goldie.`
*   **Illyasviel von Einzbern:** *Recognizes her as the Grail vessel. Kills her and Berserker without hesitation in UBW.* `No mercy for kids when they're inconvenient.`
*   **Lancer (C√∫ Chulainn):** *Sees him as just another dog to put down. Respects his tenacity in Fate route when Lancer holds him off for half a day, but still kills him easily.*
*   **The Gods:** *Hates 'em. Blames them for Enkidu's death, for the Bull of Heaven, for generally being dicks.* *His low Divinity rank reflects this hatred.*

**Role in Fate/stay night: The Golden Obstacle** *Okay, how does King Asshole fit into the actual plot? Mostly by showing up, being arrogant, and making things worse.*

*   **Fate Route:** *Plays advisor/instigator to Kirei. Shows up mostly to taunt Saber and try to claim her.* *Kills Caster casually.* *Fights Saber, overpowers her with Ea, leaves her wounded.* *Gets betrayed by Lancer, fights him, wins (after 12 hours!).* *Final boss alongside Kirei. Fights Saber again at Ryuudou Temple. Overconfident, gets wrecked when Saber uses **Avalon** to block Ea and nails him with Excalibur.* *His dying words? Admits some things are beautiful *because* you can't have them.* `Too little, too late, buddy.`

*   **Unlimited Blade Works (UBW) Route:** *Much bigger role here. He becomes the **main antagonist**.* *Kirei "lends" him to Shinji after Rider dies.* *Kills Illya and Berserker.* *Interrupts Shirou vs. Archer, tries to kill Archer, reveals Grail truth.* *Decides to use Shinji as the Grail core (using Illya's heart).* *Starts his "cleanse humanity" plan. Final battle against Shirou inside Unlimited Blade Works. Gets **humiliated** as Shirou copies his treasures and beats him down.* *Tries one last cheap shot, gets grabbed by the Grail mud trying to use him as a core. Archer snipes him while he's stuck. Poof.* `Satisfying end.`

*   **Heaven's Feel (HF) Route:** *Minimal role, thankfully.* *Shows up early, tells Sakura to die.* *Talks smack with Kirei.* *Later, tries to kill Sakura when she's going full Dark Shadow mode. Underestimates her **massively**. Thinks Gate of Babylon spam will do it.* *Gets **eaten** by the Shadow. Gone. Digested quickly because Sakura feared his ego might let him fight back from the inside.* `Epic fail.`

*So, depending on the route, he's either the final challenge overcome by ideals (Fate), the ultimate arrogant bastard getting his comeuppance from the 'faker' he despised (UBW), or an early victim of his own carelessness and the route's true horror (HF).* *He‚Äôs the benchmark of power, the ultimate obstacle, and often, the architect of his own downfall due to that planet-sized ego.* `Never change, Gil. Actually, please change. A lot.`

### *Gilgamesh - Part 3: Gates, Godhood, and Glorious Gadgets*

*So, we've established Gilgamesh is a god-king tyrant with a single dead best friend and an ego the size of Mesopotamia. But how does he actually *fight* when he bothers to get off his golden ass? What makes him the supposed **strongest Heroic Spirit**? Let's get into the nuts and bolts.*

*He's the top dog, the apex predator of Servants in both the Fourth and Fifth Wars. Period.* `Or so he claims.` *His soul's got the energy of hundreds of thousands of regular souls. Dumping him into the Grail is enough to nearly fill the damn thing.* *But physically? He's only about as strong as Saber or Heracles, maybe even weaker.* `Kind of pathetic for a 2/3 god, huh?` *So why does he stomp everyone? His **main weapon**: knowing your weaknesses.* *He owns the OG versions of **every Noble Phantasm**. Every hero has a kryptonite, something that killed 'em or messed 'em up? Gilgamesh has it in his vault.* *That's why they call him the **"Servant Killer."** He doesn't fight like a single warrior; he fights like a whole damn **"war"**. Only someone who's also a walking natural disaster can even compete.*

*His "firepower" is ridiculous. Like **"5 Servants + alpha"** level. Enough to take on everyone defending Fuyuki in* hollow ataraxia*. Puts him above folks like Arcueid whose power scales to a single opponent, not an army's worth of weapons.* *But here's the rub: even with all that cheat-level strength, other Servants *can* match him. **Enkidu** is stated to be his equal in combat strength.* `So he's not totally unbeatable, just mostly.`

*Shirou thinks even a full-power Saber under Rin couldn't beat Gil. Saber herself? More cautious. She thinks she *might* win if she defends and waits for an opening.* `Brave girl.` *Rin, even after seeing Gil trash Heracles, still thinks Shirou's overhyping him.* *Shirou's logic? Saber's attributes aren't suited for fighting Gil (before he knew about Excalibur, mind you).* *Saber reckons she *could* win with Excalibur if she hits him before he pulls out Ea.* *Against Saber Alter? It's a skill match. No plot armor for Saber Alter. Gil has a slight edge due to "omnipotence and cunning," but if his Master sucks, Saber Alter could win 'cause Gil won't get backup. If his Master is charismatic enough (like Kirei)? Gil wins.* `Master buffs are weird.`

*Gil's biggest downfall, again, is his **pride and carelessness**. He rarely fights seriously. Thinks the Grail is beneath him. His ego is a handicap.* `Balances out his firepower, kinda.` *Kirei nailed it: Gil overlooks "worthless things," but nothing is truly meaningless.* *Shirou says Gil was born with his 'carelessness' skill maxed out.* *He won't go all-out against "mongrels" 'cause taking them seriously feels like losing.* *He only uses Ea on the *worthy*. Needs to test them first.* *When he *did* go all out in* hollow ataraxia*? He said it was a "once in a lifetime whim."* *He loses to Saber 'cause he's obsessed, loses to Shirou 'cause of pride, loses to Sakura 'cause he's careless.* `Love conquers all? More like plot conquers Gil.`

*Doesn't care about his clothes usually, but for a "serious" fight? Gotta look the part.* *Hates hand-to-hand. Just needs his body and the key to his vault.* *Likes showing off, but will totally just rain weapons on you from behind if he feels like it.* `No honor among kings, apparently.`

***Skills Breakdown: The Royal Treatment***

*   ***Class Skills:***
    *   **Magic Resistance (Rank E, sometimes C):** *Pathetic for a top-tier Servant. He had **zero** magic resistance in life. Gets it purely from the Archer class container.* *Under Tokiomi, it's C rank (nullifies basic spells). Under Kirei? Drops to E (barely tickles spells) 'cause Kirei's mana supply sucks.* *Doesn't **really** matter though. Why? 'Cause he just blocks magic with his OP **armor** or **shields** from the vault. Repels A-rank spells easy.* *Big bada-boom spells? He just buries the caster under a mountain of Noble Phantasms before they finish chanting.* `Problem solved, Gilgamesh style.`
    *   **Independent Action (Rank A, later A+):** *Doesn't need his Master much.* *Rank A lets him wander around, ignore orders, use his NPs without draining the Master too badly (unless they're huge like Ea).* *Command Spells are the only way to force him.* *After getting **incarnated** by the Grail mud? Bumps up to **A+**. Now he needs **zero** mana from a Master. Can stick around indefinitely. Basically bends the rules of the Grail War. It's how he chills for 10 years between the 4th and 5th Wars.* *Kirei feeds him soul-juice from orphans, but Gil claims he didn't even need it.* `Sure, Jan.`

*   ***Personal Skills:***
    *   **Divinity (Rank B, should be A+):** *He's 2/3 god, lineage stronger than Heracles. Should be top-tier Divinity.* *But he **hates** the gods for killing Enkidu and generally being annoying. That hatred knocks his rank down to B.* `Spite literally lowers his god-level.` *Still high, though.*
    *   **Golden Rule (Rank A):** *Dude's fated to be rich. Not literal gold in his veins, but a destiny to attract wealth.* *Rank A means money is never, ever a problem. Lives like a king 'cause he *is* the king.* *This skill is why his vault is so full. He naturally acquired all the world's treasures back in the day.* `Must be nice.`
    *   **Charisma (Rank A+):** *Highest possible rank. Not just leadership, it's practically sorcery or a curse.* *His presence alone boosts army morale to insane levels. He could build a global empire.* `If he could be bothered.` *His sheer ego fuels it.* `Or maybe everyone's just scared shitless.` *In FGO, gets upgraded to **The One Who Saw It All (EX Rank)**.*
    *   **Collector (EX Rank):** *The talent for getting rare shit. It's just luck that draws cool items to him.* *Master gets no benefit, sadly.* *He collects treasures instinctively. His claim? He gathered **every** piece of tech from his era.* *Not just items, but the **"essence of human ingenuity."** Anything made *after* him by "Post-Humans" or aliens? Not in the vault.* `So no lightsabers, damn.` *In FGO, this gets upgraded to **Treasury of Babylon (EX Rank)**.*

***Noble Phantasms: The Hoard***

*   **Gate of Babylon: The King's Treasure (Rank E ~ A++):** *His bread and butter. The dimensional vault containing **all** the treasures of the world (or at least, all the prototypes from his era).* *He accesses it via a golden ripple in space, pulls out weapons, and usually just **shoots** them like crazy-fast, deadly arrows.* *Swords, spears, axes, hammers, shields, weird shit ‚Äì you name it, he's probably got the original.* *He *can* wield them normally, but why bother when you can spam?* `Quantity has a quality all its own.`
    *   *Weakness? He's not a master **wielder** of any specific weapon. He just owns them. This leaves openings for true masters (like Saber) or bullshit copycats (like Shirou with **Unlimited Blade Works**).* *Lancelot's **Knight of Owner** is a natural counter, letting him hijack Gil's weapons, but Lancelot needed his Berserker stats to keep up.*
    *   *Identifying him is hard 'cause none of these treasures are uniquely *his*, except Ea.*
    *   **Notable Items Inside:**
        *   **Golden Armor:** *Super tough, high Magic Resistance. Blocks Sasaki Kojiro's Tsubame Gaeshi, tanks Saber's hits. Gil only wears it when he's serious or fighting things like petrifying snakes or giant bulls.* `Practical!`
        *   **Levitation:** *Some item lets him float hundreds of meters up. Perfect for raining death from above.*
        *   **Mystic Codes:** *Has tons. Can cast powerful Age of Gods magic despite not being a Caster. Rune tablets, magic staves firing flames, light beams, lightning...* `Whatever the plot needs, really.`
        *   **Ea:** *We'll get to this.*
        *   **Enkidu: Chains of Heaven:** *His *other* most trusted treasure, named after his best friend. Anti-divine chains that get stronger the higher the target's Divinity. Can bind gods themselves. Used to restrain the Bull of Heaven.* *Against non-divine targets, they're just really, really strong chains.* `Still useful for tying up mongrels.`

*   **Ea: The Sword of Rupture (Rank EX, Anti-World):** *His **strongest**, most unique Noble Phantasm. Not really a sword, more like a pillar-drill-thingy with three rotating segments.* *Predates the concept of a "sword." Represents the **primordial chaos** that existed before Heaven and Earth split.* *Its attack is **Enuma Elish: The Star of Creation that Split Heaven and Earth**.*
    *   *How it works? It doesn't cut space; it **compresses and rotates space-time**, creating a **localized reality-breaking vacuum** that pulverizes anything caught inside.* *Shows the opponent the "Truth" of creation, the hellish void before existence.* `Existential crisis: the Noble Phantasm.`
    *   *Power output is **insane**, equal to or greater than Excalibur. Can be boosted further by absorbing energy from other NPs in the Gate.* *Even clashing with Excalibur doesn't fully stop it.* *Only counter? Anti-Purge defense (like Avalon) or an attack of **equal** bullshit-level power.*
    *   *Used it against Saber in Fate route, almost won. Used it to finish Tiamat in Babylonia.* *He **refuses** to use this on anyone he deems unworthy. It's his ultimate trump card, reserved for true threats or beings he respects (in his own twisted way).*

*   **Sha Naqba Imuru: The Omniscient Omnipotent Star (Rank EX, Anti-Unit):** *His **Clairvoyance** Noble Phantasm. Basically lets him see **everything**. Reads True Names, Noble Phantasms, hidden truths instantly.* *Guides allies with perfect tactics, boosts their stats when released.* *Sees through illusions (like Caster's fake death), counts spells being prepped.* *Accurately judges opponents' abilities.* *This is how he seems to know everything, the smug bastard.* `Wish I had that for exams.`

***Incarnation: Grail Mud Bath*** *Got dunked in the corrupted Grail mud at the end of the Fourth War. Should've corrupted or killed him.* *But Gil's **ego** is so strong, it resisted the mental pollution.* `Too arrogant to be brainwashed.` *The mud couldn't digest him, so it spat him out with a **physical, flesh-and-blood body**.* *This anchors him to the world, makes his **Independent Action A+**, lets him survive for 10 years.* *Downside? Makes his human side resonate more with the modern era, apparently making him crueler and more impulsive in the Fifth War.* `So the Grail mud literally made him worse.` *In UBW, the Grail tries to suck him back in through a void on his body. In HF, Sakura's Shadow eats him, and she has to digest him fast 'cause his ego might let him fight back from inside her.* `Gross.`

***Other Junk:*** *His design is based on Gilgamesh from Tower of Druaga. Nasu insisted on the gold armor.* *Shows up everywhere: FGO, Extra, Extella, Strange Fake, Unlimited Codes, Carnival Phantasm (where he dies constantly), Today's Menu (where he works part-time jobs!)...* `Can't escape the King.`

5.name: Emiya Shirou
5.content:
### *Emiya Shirou - Part 1: From Orphaned Ash to Wannabe Hero*

*So, let's talk about the main dude, **Emiya Shirou**. Yeah, *that* guy. Teenage magic-user wannabe, Master of Saber in the Fifth Holy Grail War, and somehow manages to snag a different girl in every timeline.* `Lucky bastard, or maybe just cursed?` *Adopted son of the infamous Magus Killer, **Kiritsugu Emiya**, sorta-kinda adopted brother to Illya, and the younger, less cynical version of that red-coated pain in the ass, **EMIYA**.*

**The Beginning: Trial by Fire (Literally)** *Ten years before the shit hits the fan in* Fate/stay night*, Shirou was just some normal kid living in Shinto. Then? **Boom**. The Fourth War ends, the Grail spills its toxic guts all over town, and a massive fire cooks everything.* `Thanks, Gilgamesh and Kirei.` *Shirou's parents? Toast. He's barely alive, buried in the inferno, probably seeing his short life flash before his eyes.*

*Who pulls him out? **Kiritsugu Emiya**. Fresh off indirectly causing the whole damn disaster and feeling like total shit, Kiritsugu spots this dying kid. Maybe it's guilt, maybe it's a desperate need to actually **save** someone for once without it backfiring.* *Whatever the reason, he jams **Avalon**, Saber's super-healing scabbard, into Shirou's body. Poof. Kid's saved. Mortal wound? Gone.* `Talk about a magical defibrillator.` *Kiritsugu finds him, sees the kid's alive, and just breaks down crying, relieved.* *Shirou, watching this grown-ass man weep like he's the one who got saved, gets kinda envious. That moment? Probably fucked him up more than the fire.*

*Later, Kiritsugu's like, "Hey kid, wanna be my son? Full disclosure, I'm a mage."* *Shirou, probably still high on Avalon fumes and survivor's guilt, says yes. Spends the next two years begging Kiritsugu to teach him magic. Kiritsugu's not keen, knows it's a shitty path, but eventually caves.* *His advice? "Keep it secret, use it only to help people, don't get noticed."* *Problem is, Kiritsugu's idea of 'basic training' is absolute crap. Incomplete, dangerous, basically sets Shirou up to fail spectacularly.* `Thanks, Dad.` *And worse? Kiritsugu plants that stupid **"Hero of Justice"** seed in Shirou's head. Save everyone, protect the innocent, yadda yadda. Kiritsugu was tormented by how impossible it was, but Shirou? He just sees the shiny ideal.*

*Fast forward five years. Kiritsugu's kicking the bucket, probably thanks to that Grail mud curse. Weakening daily. Shirou's left frustrated, alone, probably more messed up than ever.* *Before Kiritsugu croaks, they have that famous moonlit chat. Kiritsugu admits he failed at being a hero. Shirou, bless his naive heart, pledges to take over the dream.* **"Leave it to me, old man. Your dream... I'll make it happen."** *Kiritsugu dies peacefully, probably thinking, 'Oh god, what have I done?'* `Seriously, worst inheritance ever.`

*After that? **Taiga Fujimura**, Shirou's young, ditzy English teacher and longtime neighbor, steps in as guardian (mostly in name). Her grandpa handles the money.* *Shirou hits middle school. Meets **Shinji Matou** while fixing some signboard overnight. Shinji's usual charming self: "Hmm... you're an idiot but you actually do a pretty good job."* `High praise from Prince Dickhead.` *They become 'friends.' Sorta.*

*High school time. Homurahara Academy. Shirou gets a rep as the go-to guy for fixing **anything**. School janitor, repairman, general dogsbody. Anything to help people, 'cause that's his only source of self-worth now.* `Classic survivor's guilt response.` *Joins the archery club. Apparently, he's naturally gifted thanks to stupid good concentration or something, only misses once.* *But then he gets a bone fracture in his shoulder from a part-time job, leaving a burn scar. Shinji, ever the supportive friend, points out how ugly it is for archery.* `Seriously, fuck Shinji.` *Shirou quits the club. Their friendship gets strained but kinda stabilizes.*

*Around the time he's injured, **Sakura Matou** (Shinji's sister, poor girl) starts coming over to help cook and clean. She keeps coming even after he's healed, becoming part of his weird little surrogate family. Just hangs around, being quiet and helpful.* `Wonder if she knows what her brother's like?`

**Appearance: Just Some Guy** *So what does this walking trauma case look like? Teenage dude, auburn hair that's kinda messy, golden-brown eyes. Average height, maybe? Build's probably decent from all the odd jobs and archery.* *His default outfit is iconic in its own way: that blue and white baseball jersey thing with long sleeves, blue jeans. Simple.* *At school? Same shirt under the standard Homurahara uniform jacket.* `Creature of habit.`

*Later, in Heaven's Feel, if he gets wrecked, Touko Aozaki builds him a **puppet body**. Apparently, it's a close match to the original. Wears simpler stuff then, like a long-sleeve shirt and black pants.* `Gotta wonder if the puppet feels survivor's guilt too?`

*The anime adaptations love giving him extra clothes. Sometimes a black and white zip jacket over his usual gear. In UBW, he rocks a charcoal tartan scarf with his uniform.* `Trying to look cool for Rin?` *Other outfits pop up too: plain white long sleeve, black hooded coat, black long sleeve.* *Still, the baseball jersey is his signature look.* *Not flashy, not trying to stand out. Just... Shirou.* *Maybe he's trying to blend in, disappear after surviving when so many didn't?* `Or maybe he just has no fashion sense.`

### *Emiya Shirou - Part 2: Broken Ideals, Awkward Romances, and Why He Fixes Toasters*

*So, you got the gist of how Shirou ended up being Shirou ‚Äì fire, Avalon patch-up, deadbeat mage dad leaving him with a hero complex the size of Fuyuki. Now, let's slice into his **personality**. And hoo boy, is it a wreck.*

*That fire? Didn't just scar his body, it hollowed him out inside. He‚Äôs got **survivor's guilt** cranked up to eleven. Thinks it's fundamentally **wrong** that he lived when so many others didn't. So, what's his coping mechanism? Become a goddamn doormat. Prioritizes everyone else's needs over his own, 'cause how dare he want anything for himself after being the sole survivor? Finds his only self-worth in helping people, **no reward needed**. The act itself is the payment.* `Kinda fucked up, right?` *He genuinely believes it's unfair that some people survive and others don't. So, jump in front of a bus for a stranger? Sure, why not? Gets himself hurt constantly.*

*People around him? Worried sick, obviously. Try to tell him, "Dude, chill, take care of yourself!" Does he listen? **Nope**. He's got that death pledge to Kiritsugu locked in: become a **Hero of Justice**. Save everyone. Protect everyone. Even if it costs him his life, his sanity, whatever. That dream is **everything** to him.* `Talk about unhealthy coping mechanisms.`

*How does this play out? Depends on who he's trying to impress that week:*
*   **Fate Route:** *Full-on idiot mode. Saber's a walking nuke, but Shirou's **constantly** trying to shield her, keep her out of fights. Why? 'Cause he can't stand seeing someone hurt *for him*. Never backs down from his ideals, even when it gets him stabbed, slashed, nearly killed multiple times. Sticks to his guns, no matter how stupid.*
*   **Unlimited Blade Works Route:** *Gets a reality check courtesy of his future self, Archer. Constant arguments. Archer basically yells "You're a hypocrite, your ideals are bullshit!" Shirou... kinda sees it? But does he give up? **Fuck no**. He bends, finds a middle ground. Admits the dream is impossible, but vows to strive for it anyway.* `Progress? Maybe? Still sounds exhausting.`
*   **Heaven's Feel Route:** *The ultimate test. Keep being a hero, or save Sakura? This time, the girl wins.* `Mostly.` *He chucks his ideals out the window (*except for one specific ending where he goes full Kiritsugu cold-blooded*). His new purpose: protect Sakura, no matter what. Still gets torn up about it, though.*

*Beyond the hero complex? He's **stubborn as a mule**. Once he decides on something, good luck changing his mind. Spent hours trying a high jump he couldn't make ‚Äì that's the kind of dumb persistence that apparently makes girls fall for him.* `Weird taste, ladies.` *He defends his messed-up views fiercely, even if it hurts people he cares about.* *But if he thinks someone deserves their shitty situation? He'll just watch. Cold streak under all that self-sacrifice.*

*Socially? He's kinda awkward. Can flip from sarcastic to dead serious without warning. People think he's dense sometimes 'cause he's so bad at showing what he feels.* `Probably 'cause he barely knows himself.` *Nasu apparently said he wouldn't get along with Shiki Tohno from Tsukihime.* `Probably too much shared trauma, they'd just stare awkwardly at each other.`

**Relationships: The Harem Protagonist Lottery** *Who falls for this broken dude? Seems like half the female cast.*

*   **The Main Trio:**
    *   **Saber (Fate Route):** *He gets obsessed with protecting her, insists she shouldn't fight. Falls hard, wants her to stay even though it goes against everything she believes.* `Selfish much?` *Eventually respects her choice, holds onto the memories. Unless you count the secret ending where they meet in discount heaven.*
    *   **Rin Tohsaka (UBW Route):** *Initial crush. He admires her. Finds out her "perfect honor student" act is a front? Likes her **even more**. Teams up with her, lots of bickering, falls in love. Becomes her apprentice after the war, moves to London with her. She promises to keep him from becoming *too* much of a suicidal hero.* `Good luck with that, Rin.` *In the Good End? Saber sticks around too, living with them.* `Awkward threesome dynamic, go!`
    *   **Sakura Matou (HF Route):** *Notices her "growth" (yeah, right) even before the war. His feelings for her become the whole damn plot. Ditches his ideals to save her from her horrific situation.* `Finally picks one person over the abstract 'everyone'.`

*   **Other Key Players:**
    *   **Archer (EMIYA):** *Instant rivalry. Jealousy (especially over Rin in UBW). Thinks Archer's cool but hates his guts.* `Sibling rivalry taken to a whole new level.` *Their connection in UBW forces Shirou to confront his own bullshit.*
    *   **Taiga Fujimura:** *Teases her constantly, acts like she's annoying, but deep down loves her like family. She's the one stable adult figure he had after Kiritsugu died.*
    *   **Illyasviel von Einzbern:** *Terrified of her at first (rightfully so). Later? Fiercely protective, even before knowing she's technically his stepsister.* `Guess the Emiya protective instinct kicks in.`
    *   **Rider (Medusa):** *Yeah, apparently he finds her attractive too.* `Kid's got diverse tastes, gotta give him that.` *Mostly interacts with her in Heaven's Feel when she becomes his ally.*

**Hobbies: Mr. Fix-It and Domestic God** *What does this emotionally stunted hero-wannabe do for fun? Oddly mundane stuff.*

*   **Housework:** *He's ridiculously good at it. Cooking, cleaning ‚Äì he does it all, despite Taiga being his official guardian.* *Japanese food is his jam. Doesn't skimp on ingredients.* *Teaches Sakura, they have cook-offs.* `Domestic bliss amidst magical warfare.`
